name: Grand Ole Opry
reviews: Amazing place. Went for charity foundation concert. Atmosphere great and seats comfy. We were up in the balcony but view was good. All artists excellent and sound quality fab. Stayed locally enough to be able to walk. If you get the opportunity to go, take it and enjoy.

Very nice! As someone not familiar with country music, the Opry, Nashville, or even the South in general (California-Colorado girl here), it was an absolute pleasure to learn and familiarize myself with such a rich history and culture! Definitely made our trip fabulous! (We did a backstage tour, as well as a Saturday live Opry show the day after.)

We can mark this one off our bucket list! Opry is a must see! The tour lead our group to all the behind-the-scenes secrets. The wall of inductees, the dressing rooms, and we even got the option to have our photo taken on stage in 'the circle' that I've only heard about over the years growing up. What a wonderful experience, to be given the opportunity to relive and walk with country music!

We did the backstage tour and loved it. I'm not even big country guy but I still found the tour very informative and engaging. Getting to go backstage at such a historic venue was very cool. If you can't see a show here, I highly recommend checking out the tour.

An experience we will never forget! History was made by the Grand Ole Opry on the radio and on TV. We felt like we were a part of that history with the many talented musicians/bands that played. Saw about 10 or 11 acts, each playing two songs for about 2.5 hours total. Worth every penny!

name: Nashville Zoo at Grassmere
reviews: I loved this Zoo. I love that the animals were well taken care of and they were not on cement but in actual enclosures with grass and dirt. Place was so clean and every employee that we talked to there was very knowledgeable and answered our questions we had. I got to know the history behind the zoo and to find out that they are only using not even half of the hundred and eighty acres of land they have gives them even more space to grow. Would definitely love to come back if I'm ever in this area again

This is a beautiful, clean and well maintain zoo. It has very attractive enclosures and great landscapes. It has a rope bridge over a river which is a lot of fun. They have areas for petting animals, including a kangaroo petting zone. A kangaroo petting area is something I hadn't seen before. It is a great place to take the kids or for adults that want to go for a walk and enjoy nature.

The Zoo was amazing loved seeing all of the animals. Walking around “Peru” to see the Guinea pigs and the bear was an experience! Loved the atmosphere. They put so much time and detail in making the exhibits. Their gift shop is also full of cute knickknacks and souvenirs I couldn’t pass it without buying something.

Absolutely LOVE going to this zoo! We go often and still stay ALL DAY when we go! They have so many great programs *you can view a list online* and really good ADMITTING prices for this Mommy of 5! You can purchase year round passes or even donate to the Zoo online. The food is a little expensive there, but you are welcome to bring in your own ALSO with a hand stamp you can leave and come back anytime that day. Great staff! Very knowledgeable about the Zoo's history and the  animals! I Homeschool my children *so it's definitely a perfect learning experience for my little ones. Always enjoyable!

I love zoos and this one was one to love. So many animals it was hard to get through all of it but we did it. There is an interesting inside exhibit with tons of wildlife. I like that many of the animals they had in captivity were endangered and the aim was to preserve the species. Kangaroo garden was my favorite part.

name: The Parthenon
address: 2500 West End Ave, Nashville, TN 37203, USA
reviews: $6.00 is probably the cheapest (but awesome) experience in Nashville. It is the only one in the entire world that is fully restored and built in scale. The bottom entrance is where the gift shop and ticket sales are. If you are around downtown I would def recommend visiting it. Everyone is friendly and the guides are free. They also over tours at 2 PM.

I was in the area with my best friend so we went to take a look.  Its existence is magnetic and filled me with curiosity. I could not help comparing to the original in Athens, so it’s placement, so low to the ground, was very deflating. 

The visitors, were mostly quite cheery, but I had a hard time calming my curiosity, to actually appreciate the structure. It was fun, it provided an activity, and something to do, nevertheless, the awe factor was missing. It appears small, yet it may have been be duplicated to scale? The Athena statue inside is painted and not beautiful. 

It has great potential, and is certainly a note worthy undertaking, yet I did not sense an intended outcome. It felt very cement like and I kept thinking it would be a sweet,  Greek revival,  public  library. I really don’t know what to say, really.

I give this site a four stars because it provides a lovely activity in a lovely setting. Although, I personally struggle with understanding it’s artistic place in the world, I do feel that it is a heartfelt offering that has provided a really wonderful place to visit.

This is an awesomely large structure. We didn’t do the tour, but walked around the outside. Very pretty walking path. The Athena may be only a statue to some but I can tell you, the spirit of a goddess most certainly dwells there. As I went before the goddess and bowed I was flooded with her presence to the point my face burned red hot and I was moved to tears. For a few moments I knew nothing else but that presence, everything around me simply melted away and I was wholly connected to the goddess. It is a once in a lifetime experience. I could not more highly recommend you visit. But come in reverence because you will be in the presence of a goddess. The history of the building and pictures of the original exhibition that this was built for was far more interesting than expected. There is also a small art gallery and the enormous statue of Athena to see as well as the building itself. It is worth a visit but not too much else round the area to see.

I enjoyed the location. It was a very muggy day but seeing this monument/museum was pretty cool. I thoroughly enjoyed taking photos and video of the location there was a lot of construction going on so I was not able to get really good photos. The construction made it very muddy though so I’m giving it three stars when I come back and everything is completed hopefully I can add the extra two stars.

Was under construction when we visited but still very cool. If you are into Greek Mythology it is definitely worth paying the price to go inside the Parthenon. But also a great park to just walk around and enjoy the lake and flowers. Nice place to find in an Urban environment

name: Ryman Auditorium
reviews: I understand why this is such an acclaimed spot for live music.  Besides the history (which alone is cool), every seat in the house is a good seat.  All seating are church pews and the entire venue is pretty small.  The acoustics are great and the music really does sound amazing no matter where you are listening.  The balcony is great to see a band and even if you're in the back you are still close enough to really see the action.

If you love live music, you have to see a band here. Sound quality is close to perfect. Some seats have a pole in front of you. But that ends up being a non issue since you will probably be standing up anyways. Staff is courteous and helpful. Look for a band you like or even marginally like and see them here. You won't be disappointed.

Beautiful historical Nashville landmark.  Venue allows for excellent views of performers from many seats.  Our favorite is balcony middle, at least 4 rows above edge of balcony, so please don't buy our seats 😅😂🤣 

Seating is on wooden pews without cushions.  Inflatable cushions are prohibited. (There's no prohibition against coats.  A fiber filled coat folds into a nice cushion.)

If you have difficulty with stairs, there are seats at the top of the balcony.  Excellent provision for those in wheelchairs or assisted-walking devices.

Venue staff are very helpful, so feel free to ask them your questions.

Security screening is conducted BEFORE entering the venue.  ABSOLUTELY NO POCKET KNIVES of any size.  The staff prohibited a Victorinox Swiss Army Classic knife which has a tiny 32x6mm (1.25x0.25inch) blade, so leave ALL blades in your vehicle.

Came here for the Josh Gates show. Our family all had a great time. The venue is small, so as long as your view is not obstructed by the pillars, your seat will be good. The bar inside is outrageously expensive, so if you want drinks I would highly recommend you go somewhere else before the show. Sound and lighting are always great. The ushers are super helpful and very nice.

WONDERFUL place to see a show and the history there is unbelievable.  Our 2-year old son attended his first physical concert here (1st concert was when my wife was 2 months pregnant with him at the same location to see the same band!) and the staff was so sweet and kind to him.  We will make a trip here every time we're in the Nashville area.  Highly recommended!!!

name: Centennial Park
address: 2500 West End Ave, Nashville, TN 37203, USA
reviews: One of the must see destinations for visitors to Nashville but also a great weekend standby for locals. Gorgeous park, great space for walking with your dog or just relaxing on the lawns. Often times there are great food trucks, but it's also nearby a ton of excellent bars and restaurants. Start your weekend here and take your pick of where to go next. Having relocated out of Nashville, this is the place we miss the most. Visitors should your inside of the Parthenon at least once, but they do rotate the exhibits in the art gallery which rewards repeat visits.

The park is free but the Parthenon is $6.00 and probably the cheapest (but awesome) experience in Nashville. It is the only one in the entire world that is fully restored and built in scale. The bottom entrance is where  the gift shop and ticket sales are. If you are around downtown I would def recommend visiting it. Everyone is friendly and the guides are free. They also over tours at 2 PM. Looks like they are getting ready to expand  from all the gated off spots and equipment. It wasn’t crowded at all on Sunday around 12:30.

Loved visiting here. So much history, so much fun in one place. The staff are generally helpful. Many photo opportunities. Centennial Dog Park is right there in the same vicinity making bringing your furry friends easy. Enjoy your visit. . . We sure did!!

The park has a beautiful lake that is home to ducks and Canadian geese. There are flower gardens & a neat stacked stone bridge that make great photo spots. The Parthenon is also here. It is a replica of the original & houses an art gallery & an impressive 41 foot gold gilded statue of the goddess Athena.

Was under renovation last time we visited. Was breath takeing perfect place to being a date for a walk. Would be nice if the added areas to picnic and maybe a dog park. Nice reflection pond. It's in a good area. Traffic is kinda rough but the parking is very close.

name: Bicentennial Capitol Mall State Park
address: 600 James Robertson Pkwy, Nashville, TN 37243, USA
reviews: Highly recommend this park, especially the guided ranger hikes. The evening hike with Ranger Wayne was extremely informative. Pleasant walk up the capital steps and around the capital building. Nice views of the city during the sunset, and the buildings at night. Also included information on the statues and displays around the campus.

Far exceeded expectations!  It's flat out wonderful.  It's free with much to learn, much to see and much to do. It's very pretty and certainly as educational as u can get. It's a close walk to the state Capitol and close to downtown Nashville.  I'd go there again and again!

This is a very interesting park with lots of historical appeal. I found the wall of TN events fascinating and the massive map of TN capture my attention for a considerable amount of it. It's also just a pretty area right in the heart of Nashville. I thoroughly enjoy it.

I love this area because of the vast amount of things you can do. There's a food mall, marketplace, spots to picnic, and lots of space to walk, jog, or ride a bike. What makes it even better is that it's right next to the city area where it's a bit more busy.

This park is a real treasure and unique in our state parks system.  I think every one of our large Tennessee cities need to plan for an urban state park such as this one.  I could tell this park is well used, well maintained,  and well appreciated by downtown workers and visitors to the city.   The farmer's market located adjacent to the park enhances the outdoor experience.   I bought fresh turnip greens and acorn squash--locally grown--and wish I had bought a basket of apples.

name: Lane Motor Museum
reviews:
This museum is nothing short of amazing. It boasts America’s most extensive collection of European vehicles, and that is evident. Housed in the former Sunbeam bread factory, the clean, open space is full of cars, scooters, bikes, and other assorted vehicles, including two cars propelled with airplane like propellers.
I ran across this hidden gem while researching the Tatra car company of Czechoslovakia, and I was elated to see several beautifully restored specimens. The beauty and oddity did not stop there, though. Just observing the Ingenious approaches to locomotion filled one’s imagination with the hours and energy invested into the unique designs.
Rex and Jessie were top notch guides. Their knowledge and enthusiasm made conversing about trends, engineering, and styling a true pleasure, and seeing all these magnificent examples tickled the imagination.
I am blind and was loaned some cotton gloves, so I could caress the exhibits. Rex and Jessie took the time to make me feel like an honored guest and cheerfully pointed out the unique aspects to each of the vehicles we viewed.

Fantastic treatment of these unique and important autos. These are loved and it shows. And the building! Fantastic. Excellent staff treatment and conversation. Made for an excellent destination with our Harley riding group. Worth the visit, and will be coming again for sure.

I just spent 4 hours walking around nonstop. This place is fantastic! To my delight it had brilliant additions like bicycles, motorcycles, mini cars, airplanes, and so many items I've never heard of! If you have some time definitely do this one!

Really enjoyed seeing rare cars, bikes and other vehicles and learning some cool facts as well. Fun for the entire family and a must see for any automotive enthusiast. (Sidenote: Was really impressed with how clean the bathrooms were!)

I honestly don't even care about cars, but this place had me gawking at them for four hours. It was a huge surprise and a good one. Such an amazing collection of history, and vehicles of almost unbelievable design. It's also worth mentioning that there is a pretty cool mini museum of bicycles inside as well.

name: Frist Art Museum
reviews: To be honest, the place could be much bigger. But that has more to do with the really well made exhibits. I've been to a few of their exhibitions now and I can say that it is worth going to because they are well coordinated and thoughtfully curated. They use the digital aids kinda sparsely; like the touch screens, but they do it to a point and its apparent when you experience it.

We have enjoyed the Frist Art Museum several times and this visit was just as great. We loved the Eric Carle exhibit very much, along with the Native Indian Women art exhibit. The museum itself used to be the Nashville post office. We have enjoyed each exhibit we have encountered there. There is a pay-lot for parking. If you are traveling to Nashville be sure to make time for this museum.

Excellent place for Children ages 2-5 maybe 6... I went during the Eric Carl exhibit which was geared towards kids to begin with. However that was not the best part. The activity center for kids was excellent. They had art activities, camera and motion stuff. My daughter had a blast and the staff was very friendly.  We will be returning. I will admit we have not attended during an exhibit geared towards adults but I look forward to doing so.

This museum is AMAZING and the price is great. Kids 18 and under are free which is always great. College students are 10 dollars and free certain days. The museum offers rotating exhibits. This month was Eric Carle and it was cool. They also have a whole area where you can do arts and crafts and other activities. I will definitely be taking the kids back.

Loved the Eric Carle exhibit! The Frist is open late on Thursday and Friday, so it's a great place to go after work and unwind. There were a few events there and lots of people - great vibrant atmosphere! The college student discount is an excellent deal too. Parking is $2/hr, thanks to the museum discount.

name: Adventure Science Center
address: 800 Fort Negley Blvd, Nashville, TN 37203, USA
reviews:
I actually signed up to be a member of Adventure Science Center last year, and will probably keep renewing indefinitely.  

My son has the best time running around and playing with their exhibits, be it the new features that change every few months or the static exhibits (some of which I played on when I was a kid, and don't worry they reflect current science, and I mean real science with evidence and whatnot). 

There's a tower to climb with slides and neat interactive features, each of which constructed to impart some focused learning as the kids explore.  The planetarium has cool shows that also change regularly.  On that note, it's not all for kids.  There are monthly events after hours for adults, and laser shows set to various musoc features.

Our family had a blast visiting this science museum! It seems like it's for kids on the younger side (similar to the children's museum we are used to in MN), but had things for all ages. Our 4-year-old had so much fun he didn't ever want to leave. We especially enjoyed the planetarium show in addition to the interactive exhibits

The imagination runs wild for young and old alike. Wonderful, clean, friendly environment that ignites curiosity, creativity, and involves all senses. Fabulous place for kids and adults alike. Creative, interactive displays involve kids and inspire one to consider the inner workings of everything from the human body to sound and light waves to outer space. The planetarium is a favorite as well and with good reason. It's truly an educational and beautiful experience. Overall, and outing with o the Adventure Science Center provides education, fun and exercise for the whole family on a rainy day. Kids can run around the multilevel playground to burn off energy as well. In addition to all of this, there are spectacular views of downtown Nashville from the large, North facing windows. Highly recommended.

Wonderful child-friendly museum with a great set of hands-on exhibits and displays that introduce kids to music, science & engineering, animals and the human body. Definitely one of the best places to take your children on a rainy day if you live in the greater Nashville area. Prices appear a bit steep at first glance but buying an annual membership is the way to go. Some of the stations or activities are a bit dated but the museum is undergoing a long-term renovation that’ll only improve the experience for families.

This place was so much fun. We took my three children (all under 10) and they had a blast. There was plenty to see, touch, and do. The place was clean and crazy busy. We went during the week and there were multiple school groups there. My only complaint was the school kids were pushy and at times obnoxious. The teachers with the groups didn't seem to mind or were over extended and couldn't pay attention. I was annoyed after the third child that was three times the size of my toddler took things out of her hands. It the facility could somehow help monitor the school groups it would be a five star "adventure." We didn't try the cafeteria so I can't comment on that.

name: Radnor Lake State Park
address: 1160 Otter Creek Rd, Nashville, TN 37220, USA
reviews: I'd give 5 stars, but parking may be difficult to come by. Even with as few parking spots as there are there's still a lot of people here. It is peaceful, serene, and a decent hike for beginners (if you take the hills), but ultimately it's just a nature walk. The animals will let you get close. Great photo ops if you're actually looking for them.

Really nice place to walk.  A surprise close to the city! Parking lot wasn't very big for as many people who wanted to visit, but it was free. Great place for a long walk, watching the turtles, or frogs, or leaves. Very quiet and peaceful.

Super friendly rangers, neat to see electric charging spots offered, clean and interesting snippets of local wildlife inside - but get out on them trails, our large group loved the day and went around the lake. Really great place!

Idyllic and easy to fit hikes into any schedule as long as parking cooperates. Made a full loop around the lake in an hour and a half (walking a leisurely pace).

Watch out for wildlife-- beginning of February but we already saw a copperhead coiled up not a foot from the trail edge.

When visiting Nashville we wanted to take the opportunity to visit some of the nature versus being in bars/museums all day and night. Well worth it! We saw two Bald Eagles as well as at least 15 wild turkey on our hike.

name: Cheekwood
address: 1200 Forrest Park Dr, Nashville, TN 37205, USA
reviews: Beautiful property.  While its not quite spring yet and most plants in the gardens were not in bloom,  it was still nice to visit and walk around.  The mansion had beautiful art galleries filled with gorgeous orchids throughout the place.  Must visit if you are ever passing the area. There is a gift shop and cute cafe with courtyard to sit outside and eat.  There is even areas in the botanical garden for children to enjoy. So whether it's date night or family time out, there's something to be enjoyed by everyone.

The lights were very pretty for the holidays and well done. It is great that you also get access to the museum and art works with your ticket. I would definitely recommend this as well as the Nashville Zoo for things to do at night in the winter. It is great for a date night or a time out with family and friends. My favourite part were the lights over the ponds that reflected back. It takes about an hour and a half at least to walk through if you wanted to stop and see everything and even had deer for the holiday season.

It is so beautiful & pleasant here! Great place to get a good walk in for exercise. We went on a Sunday morning & met Dr. Cindy for Tai Chi in the garden. We loved it so much we signed up for her classes at Vanderbilt. There's much history to learn and a wide variety of plants, trees, flowers, etc to learn about. Various eateries to choose from, some offer live music ranging from folk to classical. It's a lovely place to visit!

Christmas Tour:  Beautifully decorated estate and mansion.  Paved walking paths throughout the grounds.  Spectacular light display.  Takes a couple of hours to do the entire self tour.  Worth every penny!  Can't wait to go back in the Spring.

The Christmas lights were wonderful!! And the fact they have the house open late to also tour it was great. Loved the history of the family & the grounds just as much as the festive decorations outside!! The train/toy room in the basement was definitely a favorite.

name: Musicians Hall of Fame and Museum
reviews: Hard to find parking and it wasn't cheap to park. Entrance to the museum was in a strange place. It was fairly pricey to get in, but if you are into the musicians side of music... it is a very enjoyable museum.  We spent 2 hours and weren't bored. People working there were very nice too.

Country music is not my particular flavor of music but I enjoyed very much learning and appreciating this music.  This Country Music Hall of Fame is worth a visit.  Very fun museum. The hands on, interactive Grammy gallery was my favourite part! I didn't think I would spend nearly 3 hours here. Music lovers should come and jam.

Pricey but so interesting and fun. My teenagers and I had a great time here. The interactive exhibits were amazing. We spent hours playing instruments, learning to drum with Ringo Starr, pretending we were in a recording studio and more. The Jimi Hendrix exhibit was my favorite.

The exhibits ranged in quality a bit. Many of them were interactive, which was fun. Overall, I felt it was overpriced. This place would be best for very serious music lovers and for people who are primarily interested in older musicians. Very contemporary artists were represented only minimally. Street parking at a meter is $2.75ish per hour and this museum can be easily explored in it's entirety in less than two hours.

Great place. Was uncertain whether this would be suitable for our kids or not (11, 9, 7 years) but they loved it even more than my wife and I did. Great place with a whole lot to do for the entire family. Lots of interactive stuff where you can test your vocals (karaoke and recording studio) and dj skills. Also pretty good selection of articles from numerous artists. Highly recommended!!

name: John Seigenthaler Pedestrian Bridge
reviews: Always a fun spot to visit, I often take out of town guests to visit the bridge for good views and photos. I’ve had friends get engaged on the bridge and usually there are some folks playing music that lends to a fun atmosphere. Overall a great little piece of Nashville. There’s also good places to park near the bridge and Nissan stadium as long as there isn’t an event, as always though pay attention to signage to avoid trouble.

A fantastic view of downtown Nashville!   EPIC sunsets!   And the perfect place to spend on a date with your special someone.    
Every time we visit Nashville, walking the bridge is on our bucket list.   There are always lots of people and plenty to see.  
If you're visiting Nashville, this is absolutely a great spot!  
Perfect for couples getting engaged or just wanting romance for the evening.
It's a nice place to spend the afternoon, but they could just keep it clean it would be better. When you walk you can smell urine. It was kinda shady too but the city view was nice.

One of the best views in Nashville aside from the roof top bars! It's a great place to walk and look down the river and see the city. It does have a fairly steep incline going up the bridge, so I advise those that are handicapped to use the elevator if possible. It is a very hot spot for tourists to take photos. The views are just amazing!

Wish I would have known about the parking lot before emptying my wallet at other parking lots. Parked there twice now, once during the day and once at night and as far as I can tell, you don’t pay to park there. It’s a 5-10 min walk to broadway from there. At nights it’s an excellent view

name: Nashville Symphony | Schermerhorn Symphony Center
reviews: An exquisite evening of culture right in our own backyard! Go to the conductor's discussion before the performance.  It is the perfect orientation to the music you will hear during the evening, especially if you enjoy an occasional evening of classical music but aren't an expert. So much talent! Highly recommended.

This was the perfect venue. It was beautiful and the sound was perfect! I could only dream of performing there. There were nice people at every turn to guide us to our seats. The Getty concert was absolutely wonderful. We plan to return next year.
Also, the parking was really close and protected. Great experience!

Beautiful! The venue felt a little bit like a Jane Austin era building with 1920s amazing lamps and velvety chairs. They were narrow on my well endowed hips, but many people left at intermission so there was plenty of room. We were on the back row of the highest balcony and it felt closer to the stage than the closest balcony at the Atlanta symphony. Each level had its own parlor for intermission with wine, water and soda available. I did not order any wine because it was 12 dollars for a glass. But my friend did and said the red was very good.

I just went and saw Star Wars: Return of the Jedi with the Nashville Symphony playing the soundtrack. It was great! Even though the orchestra was right in front of me, I would forget they were there. The music was perfectly in sync with the movie. It was a really cool experience!

And a note on the Schermerhorn: it is an absolutely beautiful building!

Great first experience here seeing Foreigner play with the Symphony! There are truly no bad seats in the building. The sound was incredible. The staff was friendly and helpful. I definitely want to go back!

name: Madame Tussauds Nashville
address: 515 Opry Mills Dr, Nashville, TN 37214, USA
reviews: As with all Madame Tussauds, this place delivers!  Loved the history in this Madame Tussauds.  Very fun - but wish they had something extra like NYC with the hand molds.  Maybe offer a microphone with your favorite singer embedded or something?  The shop is a bit small with not too much to offer.

Very fun place, free parking and all the options to eat. The museum with all of the wax figures is awesome, whit a lot of music, and if you go to the museum in important dates probably the figures changes its clothes. You can also take photos with the figures and clothes, touch it and make fun photos and selfies with your favorites singers. The wax figures aren't only of country singers, they also have pop and rock famous artist. This experience is one of the best being in Nashville

Very fun and realistic people. You can get free tickets by paying for the old trolley bus ride or the hop on hop off bus. They have a gift shop that’s pretty cheap and they take your pictures in one of the rooms. Would definitely recommend.
Omg I absolutely love this place. Me and my wife had so much fun here. Will be coming back again when we visit.
This was a lot of fun. I loved that there were guitars hanging on the wall to really add to the experience. It was fun for the whole family.

name: Historic RCA Studio B
address: 1611 Roy Acuff Pl, Nashville, TN 37203, USA
reviews: This was an awesome addition to the regular country music hall of fame museum. I would highly recommend everyone to do it if they have the time. It really has a lot of lore and why wouldn't you want to be in same building as the king of rock once was!?

If you have thoughts of where a lot of the great music from country to rock n roll was recorded, well it's a must see. From the hotspot- where they would stand and sing to the actual piano where all the greats played (ELVIS and so on) which is still been used today. Wow!

I was an inspiring recording engineer back in the 70's, it was nice to visit one of the famous recording studios.  Only 4 stars as there was too much emphasis on Elvis. Also, we were told about taking a photo of a blue star.  No one in our group saw it and nobody knew why it was important.

I can’t recommend this tour enough. Our guide was amazing. Probably the best guide I’ve ever had at any place of interest. 
This place has so much amazing history. If only walls could talk. It’s never a boring tour. 
My wife really isn’t in to any of the music produced here but she loved it. 
Incredibly interesting. You learn so much.

This tour offered so much history. The actual piano that held a special place in the heart of Elvis was housed here and we were even given the chance to see touch and get pictures with it. The tour host was so knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the rich history of this building.

name: The Johnny Cash Museum & Cafe
reviews:
Husband - 5/5, I would rate 3/5 stars. 
Positives: Did a great job clearly breaking down his life. Lots of cool items to see. Like how they included June Carter as much as they did. Great if you love history and/or country music
Negatives: If you don't like history that much, it is crowded and small.

Surprisingly good museum. I really did not expect it to be as large or well done as it is. Tickets were worth it.
By the way this is coming from someone that never listened to a single Johnny Cash song before going into this. I only went because a friend was really into it at the time. And I still enjoyed myself a lot.
That guy was a genius.

We really enjoyed our visit! I grew up listening to Johnny Cash as my parents were huge fans. The museum does a wonderful job of taking you inside of his world. I got a little misty eyed a few times because of the moving tributes. You won’t be disappointed!!

This museum has a few interesting pieces and memorabilia. They do a pretty good job of displaying everything and giving a good view of it all. The museum itself is fairly small and, in all, there doesn’t seem to be a whole lot there. It may be nice just to see the specific pieces they have that others don’t.

This was a pleasant surprise! Interesting items displayed lots of document to read and headphone for listening to music. We learned a lot of good things about Johnny Cash. He was way ahead of the idea of prison reform. And a great support of American Indian rights totally worth it and the tick was fairly priced

name: Nelson's Green Brier Distillery
reviews: Great tour led by a very knowledgeable employee. My wife and I enjoyed a chance to hear about the history of the distillery and family as well as get a chance to step out on the production floor and into the barrel house. As a big bourbon fan, I found it interesting to learn about the differences between Tennessee whiskey and bourbon. The tour also included a tasting of the Tennessee whiskey (which I thought was an excellent product so I even bought a bottle), a few Belle Meade bourbons, and a liquor. Great stop if you're in Nashville and want to experience a distillery without leaving town!
This place is fantastic! My sister and I took the tour and they had such a great story to tell about the family history. The tasting was outstanding as well. Would highly recommend.

Short and simple tour about the distillery. We had Dylan and he was super informative. Even though the tour was short, my group and I learned a lot. The tasting was good, and a great experiences for whiskey lover or beginners.
Harry did a fantastic job touring the distillery a wonderful time.  Great bourbon a must stop if visiting Nashville.  Very friendly professional and knowledgeable.

The distillery tour was super informative and we got to see the behind the scenes distillery and learn about the history and process of distilling whiskey. The tasting was also pretty good with pretty big tasting pours. I overall enjoyed visiting Nelson's Green Brier

name: The Escape Game Nashville
address: 510 E Iris Dr, Nashville, TN 37204, USA
reviews: Had a team building exercise. I'd suggest watching a few videos on how to play before going. I didn't have a clue what was going on just kinda along for the ride until everything started coming together in the game. I'd do it again. It's a lot if fun and let's adults feel like a big kid. I'd suggest eating a snack before hand and maybe bringing a water with you. 5 stars.

This was my first experience with the The Escape Game. We had the best time. We had a big party so we took up all the slots. The staff was super friendly and their energy was awesome. It completely surpassed my expectations and we are already making plans to come back for another game. I would highly recommend going with a group so that you all know each other because it is definitely an activity that requires you to interact together. If you are shy, this might not be the thing for you. Come in cool clothing as the rooms can be somewhat confined.
We did the Spec Ops room and it was great! It was very well decorated and had lots of clever puzzles we had to solve. I would gladly come back for new rooms!

We came up from Charlotte, NC to play all the rooms at The Escape Game’s Berryhill location last Saturday, 2/22/2020, and we were not disappointed. The rooms at The Escape Game are some of the very best I’ve played, 426 rooms played to date, and Kyle went above and beyond to make sure our experience was the best it could be. You better believe we’ll be coming back here the second they open a new room.

We did the ruins, mars, and heist rooms all within 24 hours. After booking our first one the other two were 20% off and they even closed out the rooms for us. We were late to our last one because a party member had gotten sick and they even let us use the full time and were willing to refund the sick player. The games themselves had puzzle types that matched the themes of the rooms and each hint-giver we had would point us in the right direction if we were having issues with a puzzle. Very fun and friendly. High quality and unique story-based puzzles.

name: Tootsies Orchid Lounge
reviews: Very cool bar. Has a unique atmosphere. The rooftop was very nice. The band playing during our visit was really good and the place just had a party feel to it. Very fun place to have some drinks and listen to music.

Tootsies is my favorite bar to watch some of the best musicians perform while trying to find that one thing that puts them on the map.  Stopped in yesterday at 1:00, got to see three different bands and didn't leave until 7:30.  I Love This Place

You have to visit this rooftop bar.

Great music and views from the rooftop.

Drinks are reasonable for Nashville.

The staff were extremely friendly and very quick to get drink orders when busy.

We had a fun time listening to the live music and catching some sun on the rooftop.
Gather a few of your friends n go.   Listen.   Check out the vibe and then try and stump them with a song request.  4 join forces and pitch in $20 to completely change genres.

2 performance stages.   Preferred the one in the back.  Just a great authentic vibe in this bar.    Quality performances for the couple of hours I spent there.  Will definitely will be visiting again when I'm back in Nashville.

name: Honky Tonk Party Express Bus
address: 208 Broadway suite b, Nashville, TN 37210, USA
reviews: Our bachelor party had a great time. Cat was our bartender and was very friendly. They let us suggest song requests and mostly let us enjoy ourselves. They took us by the stadium for great pics and did everything they could to make us comfortable. There are many options but we were very happy with our experience. Thanks!

Will DEFINITIVELY  be booking with this company again ! WE HAD A BLAST !!! Our Bus driver Was the absolute most sweetest lady !! Booking the event was So easy an stress free . It was literally like I just told the company the day I was coming an they took care of EVERYTHING else !

Did my wife’s 40th this weekend with honky tonk party bus!  It was a great time.  Kimberly,  drive us around and she was great!  Kelsey, had the music on point and drinks full the hole night.  We will have those memories forever.  Everyone should try this and drive around downtown in the bus!  Thanks again to everyone!  The communication was awesome..

Thanks

Told our large group we could bring a few people under 21 as long as they didn’t drink and then once we arrived they told us they could not come on the bus or get their money back. Pretty much lied to us, refused a refund, and told us to leave our friends or all lose our money. Extremely rude the whole time and tried to start arguments. If you’re trying to have fun in nashville these are not the people try a different bus there are a bunch!

My best friends Bachelorette party just became the best experience of my life because of Honkey Tonk Party Express! RJ was super funny and awesome.  Our bartender/DJ, Dana, was amazing!  She was the most friendly, most fun person to have on the tour with us.  We all had a blast and will never forget the memories we have created!!

name: Honky Tonk Highway
reviews:
We ate up on the patio where one of the garage doors was open, nice fresh air.  The food was very good. Home made breads and an eggplant tapenade was fantastic.   We had the calamari.   Just a touch of red pepper flakes and just the right amount of marinara sauce.

The brick oven meatball pizza just melts in your mouth.  Definitely a place to check out.
Always a great time. They seem to get some of the best bands in Nashville! Great service. Haven't eaten here yet...
Had an amazing first time experience. Would love to come back without the kiddos next time. But they enjoyed it as well.  Had some lunch at The Diner which was really good.

A walk down Nashville's Broadway Street and you can't help but hear the bands from at least two or three dozen bars playing music.  If you want to experience what I call a Honky-Tonk Bake-off then this is the place to do it. Jump from bar to bar, listening to band after band, drinking at each stop ALL DAY.

This street was super fun. High energy! Bar after bar with live music wafting into the street. This place is always full of people day and night. Many places even allow children during the day so you can bring the whole family and enjoy the afternoon.

name: The Escape Game Nashville
reviews: LOVED the rooms!  Very cool and unique games/puzzles.  Prison Break is very challenging and something you must try.  We’ve done quite a few escape rooms, and this one has some very interesting and unique features.  We also did Gold Rush, which was also a lot of fun.  Well worth your time and money!

The place is just great and they have around three different rooms. They are very kind and explain the whole process to you im case that you are scared. Besides having an amazing service the location and rooms are perfect. I recommend the game to anyone in case that you are close because you can have a great experience.

This place was amazing! It was our first time playing and we did the Prison breakout. It was so fun, luckily we were paired up with another group and they were great. We almost made it out but not quite :( Everyone who worked there was so nice and helpful, we will definitely be back! Special Thanks to their employee Jacob for a great prison break experience!

Seriously, lots of fun. We had a group of 8. We ran the Gold Rush option. And it was not easy but not too hard. 
  Previously, I’ve played a lot of escape room board games. I’ve often had to ‘cheat’ to figure out how to use the clues I was given. 
  My group did have trouble with some locks that didn’t work smoothly. During the game you have the option to get clues. And we were able to use them to figure out that we had correctly solved a puzzle but had to work the locks more. 
   The puzzles and challenges were satisfying. They weren’t cheap. And there were a number of surprises along the way. Definitely worth it. Great group activity. 
  I will be going back to run the other options. Just awesome.

What an absolutely fantastic escape room company. We visited today to do The Heist, Nashville and Gold Rush and had a wonderful experience. The staff were incredible and we were made to feel very welcome. In over 300 escape rooms that we have done around the world, Gold Rush is up there with my favourites. Can not recommend this very professional company enough. Jacob, Libby and Kim took such good care of us. We are heading to the Berry Hill location tomorrow to continue the fun!

name: Patsy Cline Museum
reviews:
I learned so much from this museum.  There was so much of Ms Patsy inside. To see some of her belongings was priceless.  You wont regret it.
The gift shop has so many beautiful things and at an affordable price. You have to go see for yourself.  It's an amazing place for an amazing woman. ❤💋💃
Wonderful experience especially if your a fan like me!
Incredible to see and nicely done. Such an important figure for female country artists everywhere.

Although the museum is relatively small, they had done such a good job putting together her successful carrier, as a wife, mom and artist. I was impressed by all the information , the authenticity of her personal belongings, furniture they gathered for our delight.
Patsy Cline Museum is WONDERFUL. Friendly staff, amazing personal items of Patsy's. Small museum but MIGHTY!!  What an amazing Patsy. RIP.

name: The Escape Game Nashville
address: 523 Opry Mills Dr, Nashville, TN 37214, USA
reviews: My time here was unimaginably great. I think it's one of my favorite things to do at the mall, and the games are always well put together, very cohesive. My game guide was Clari, and she was extremely caring about our safety needs, and celebrated our win with the same pride we felt!!

The Escape Game at Opry was so much fun that I forgot we were inside a mall! The clues were so unique and clever and kept us on our toes.  Better than any other escape room companies I’ve seen.  Will definitely book again!

We had a group of 5 adults and an infant. Our guide was Anthony. This was a first escape room experience for all of us. We did the Gold Rush one. It was soo fun! We finished with 17 seconds left! It was challenging and thrilling! I definitely recommend this escape room and location. The staff was friendly and encouraging and it was so much fun! Will do more of these in the future.

I came on my birthday and did the Special Ops room with some friends- it was SO MUCH FUN! Courtney S. was our game guide and made the experience that much more “Special”! I’ve also been through the Gold Rush room and that room was also a lot of fun. 10/10 would recommend (or I guess 5 stars....)!
Played the special ops mysterious market game and it was a ton of fun! Highly recommended! We escaped with seconds to spare!

name: Nashville Convention & Visitors Corporation
address: 150 4th Ave N G-250, Nashville, TN 37219, USA
reviews: had a great time spent Easter Sunday.

We are from Indiana. We were visiting Nashville. When we stayed at Gaylord Operland hotel but parked for 6 hours in one of your parking areas onAugust 15, 2019. We had dinner and went to a concert at the Bridgestone arena. We had 2 separate charges one for $30 and one for $45 same night. ..a total charge of $75 for 6 hrs of parking. I contacted you about this situation and asked if one charge the lesser could be refunded since we were charged twice for the same time and same parking lot. You said you couldn't do it but would give us a certain percent off on the next time we parked there. Again being out of town this is not an option since we do not use this parking. Way to go for fleecing visitors Nashville and Premier Parking.
I visit this attraction numerous times a week do to work detail it's a great place to attend if you're out of state or you're touring the facility

If you need ANY information about Nashville, this is the place! This organization is a huge part of what makes Nashville...Nashville. The staff was incredibly helpful and informative. They are passionate, hard-working, and constantly creating new plans for the City of Nashville.

This is the best place for a short weekend mini vacation. People from all over come here,  especially bachelorettes/ bachelor.   There is no better party place than here. Even people from Vegas come here to party. If you're not into drinking and clubs, TN is a huge state that has lots beautiful scenery that can be seen at Chattanooga or pigeon forge at the smoky mountains. There are tons of shopping malls and outlet stores, and of course a vast variety of food. Can't leave TN before you try out the barbecue!

name: I BELIEVE IN NASHVILLE Mural
reviews:
Lovely mural to find on our mural hunt.
(Cropped myself out the pic because I don't like it lol)

Such a cute area of nashville! Attracts a lot of tourists, so you may have to wait in line for a photo. There are lots of other wall murals in the neighborhood, though, so you can just walk around and check those out. There are also a bunch of different stores and restaurants that you can try out so that your trip to this mural isn't completely useless.
That was one of the places you definitely have to visit , nice murals all around,  be ready to take one of the time pictures,  I love Nashville!!

Today was my lucky day! 
I founded a dinosaur in front of the Mural

Nice mural to have your picture taken.  There is always someone around to take your photo.  It's located between buildings, right next to Reese Witherspoon's Draper James store.   Nice area to walk around and shop or have something to eat.  Near a residential area so you can find street parking easily.

name: Belle Meade Plantation
reviews: This place was so much fun for my boyfriend and I. Mary Jane did a fantastic job with the bourbon tasting and explaining the history of the winery and brewery. We also did a mansion tour which Sarah did a great job explaining the history of the plantation. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and everyone was very friendly. I would definitely come back to see more.

Had a great time. We went as a large group of 14 and did the tour which was awesome and super informative then got explore the grounds a bit. At the end we did the wine tasting and bought wine and other fun stuff to take home. I have recommended this place to anyone thinking about taking a trip to Nashville. It's a nice change of pace from the night life there.

Will always remain one of my favorite places. I went here the first time as a girl for a school field trip and absolutely fell in love with the entire place. It is definitely a good place to go to learn a little about Tennessee's history and to connect with the past. I believe my favorite little bitty about this place is the playhouse. It always fascinated me that its the same one the girls played in when they were little. Silly but its one of my favorite things about the place. The grounds are kept beautifully and the way the rooms are displayed is lovely and accurate. Lets not forget about that main stair case! It is absolutely beautiful.  Always feel like royalty when im on it. Love this place and love the way its represented. A gem you must see.

We visited Belle Meade with a group of 14... booking was simple, and after one cancellation they were very understanding and were able to refund the ticket. I have been to the Hermitage, so I was interested to see how this would compare. The grounds were smaller, but the decorations stayed true to the time period, and as we were told, many were original. Our tour guide was able to answer all our questions and provided excellent information. The weather was chilly and rainy but didn't have a negative impact on our tour. The wine tasting at the end was a great addition to the afternoon, and I must note the gift shop was one of the better ones I've seen, and if I didn't have a carry on suitcase I would've purchased at least a bottle of wine and six souvenirs. Highly recommend!

My husband and I are in no way horse racing enthusiasts but we both found our visit to Belle Meade Plantation completely fascinating. It is a lovely property, steeped in interesting history. After our tour we had a delicious lunch at the on-site restaurant.  We only had time to visit one historic property on our trip and were not disappointed at all with our choice of Belle Meade.

name: Cumberland Park
reviews:
Parking on the south east side of the pedestrian bridge was free when I went, which was a Thursday afternoon. No event was going on at Nissan Stadium, so more than enough parking was available.

I liked the park, the bridge was nice, the view of Downtown from across the river is very pretty, and it seemed very well kept/little to no garbage around. Would definitely go again.

Love this park!! We've been going here alot over the past 4yrs, since my daughter was born. She loves it, & so do her dad & I. Great place to go year round, but definitely more fun in the warmer weather months. 👍

The Pedestrian Bridge and Cumberland Park are a definite must-do in Nashville. Whether you're a tourist or a resident, it's a beautiful spot to be in. Park near Nissan stadium and easily access Honky Tonk district and the Riverfront. It's definitely one of our favorite places in the city.

Fun little public splash park right downtown. Safe place for families and FREE.  Perfect for a hot southern day.  There are also slides, climbing ropes and a kid sized rock climbing wall if they don't want to get wet.  Outdoor stage sometimes had small shows. Check it out!
Fun place for kids to blow off steam. Safe, conveniently located and well designed.

name: Tennessee Agricultural Museum
reviews: Very nice museum, great selection of displayed items to view, even cabins and a one room school
I've been a number of times. It's free so it is a great place to explore when you are looking for something to do. Occasionally they have special events.
Informative and family friendly opportunuties to learn about different machines and items from a different time.  Lots to explore outside and inside.
This place was totally awesome kids absolutely loved it. Loved looking at all the old stuff and tractors and visiting with the horses staff was very friendly
Beautiful place to work on a sunny Friday!

name: Percy Warner Park
reviews: The best place to go to get close to nature! It has so many options for walks from paved roads to trails. There are so many different level trails available, check out the maps to know where to best access each trail. Take water and enjoy!

What a special place we have here in Nashville. I grew up going to this park and have many great memories (except Steeplechase ‘86 but that’s a long story). Anyway, do yourself a favor and walk, run or hike a trail, have a picnic, play some ultimate frisbee or just drive one of the scenic drives. You won’t be disappointed.
A Nashville treasure! Beautiful, hilly terrain with hiking trails everywhere. It's huge too. You could explore for yeah and not discover it all.
Mossy Ridge Trail from the Deep Well entrance off HWY 100 is a little over 5 miles. Not a trail I would recommend for beginners, but a great hike not far from downtown Nashville.
One of Nashville's prized possessions. A SECRET that many are not aware of. A BEAUTIFUL piece of paradise that can NEVER be destroyed by greedy people.

name: Music City Walk of Fame Park
reviews: Beautiful place to honor musicians. The location across the street from the Country Music Hall of Fame makes this a must see. It is a great place to check out and take in all that is around you

Well worth visiting while in the downtown Nashville area. Many of the big names in Country Music have a black plaque you can visit. Can be hard to take pictures, we went on a rainy day which made the plaques very shiny to take pictures.
We enjoyed it even though we aren't a big country family. My kids love Elvis and Johnny Cash though!

Give him what it is this park is sadly understated. Yes, all the stars are there. But there are also quite a few homeless sleeping in the park, people riding through the park on scooters - kids, yet, ignoring the rules.  It really could use some sprucing up, maybe some nice shrubs and plants and flowers. It is sadly kind of drab.

Good photo op with some of the current and past country music star stars, nice little park 

Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum across the street

name: General Jackson Showboat
reviews: My husband and I were celebrating our 25th anniversary. We had a great time. The entertainment was phenomenal! They were all very talented. The food (chicken cordon blue, Mac and cheese, steamed carrots, prime rib just to name a few) was delicious. The wait staff was very professional and knowledgeable of everything. We'll be back.

I had a great time on this mini cruise. The boat staff was wonder. We did the cruise where you meet the captain and take pictures and he was fantastic and patient with everyone.  The food and decor was good. I really enjoyed the music show. The whole experience was wonderful and I'd do it again. Highly recommend.

So we did the Christmas Show in December of 2019.  Overall, the show was good, and the food was good, and it was definitely something a little different than the usual dinner and a show kind of evening.  The view of Nashville along the river on deck is quite beautiful. 

Now for the parts that I did not enjoy. The line to get in seemed to take a long time.  The wait at each of the bars to get drinks also took what seemed like excessive amounts of time.   The buffet line was also quite long.  Most of the waiting at the dinner table was ok because we had pretty good company...BUT that was by luck.  

My wife booked the evening for just the two of us, and it was not clear that we would be seated at a table of 10 with strangers.  Now it just so happened that we all got along after the initial period of uncomfortable silence, and I think we all wound up enjoying each others company, but I have to say that was pure luck. 

I would have rated this review a 4 or 5 stars if my wife and I had been seated alone.

I like it... My wife and I enjoyed it we went for the Christmas special and it was great. They show fan appreciation for a young woman who always visit every year. However it might be very loud at something during the concert performance bring headphones if you are with someone who might need it. The view for outside was great and the ride was smooth.

I will tell you that you better get ready for a show to knock your boots off. Service staff is very good and highly effective. Getting to watch the skyline of downtown come into view was breathtaking. Then the entertainment that was provided is great. Don't let me waste anymore of your time now. Buy the tickets and you will never regret it!

name: Andrew Jackson’s Hermitage
reviews: It's American History that I've come to love. I imagine being there in period seeing all the activities taking place. Especially upstairs, visualizing all the visiting children running back and forth in the upper hall separating bedrooms. You know they had to get a peak downstairs at evening guests and during parties. Not for children or teens unless they are known to be mature and have a specific interest in American History.

Wow. Such rich history here, some of which is heartbreaking. The grounds are gorgeous and very well-kept, and the tourguides (dressed to play the part) did great at bringing the past to the present and making us feel as though we had traveled back in time. I felt as though we had been transported to another world. A very eye-opening and visceral experience, and a trip to Nashville wouldn't be complete without stopping here. You won't regret immersing yourself in such a vital part of our country's history--the horrible aspects and all.

Highly recommend this trip into our Historic past. From the first moment we drove onto the property until reluctantly leaving I was enthralled with the Hermitage. I went through the museum, the tour, then walked the paths reading about the history of the place. Very worthwhile!!

American history at it's best.  The dual drama is well done.  The mansion is worth the wait in line.  We spent 3:15 and I wish I had about 45 minutes more really finish a walk of the grounds.  We spent about an hour in line to tour the mansion - we went on a Saturday at 1:00 in December.  If you go at a none busy time, if there is such a thing, maybe you could do it 3:00 hours.

Love for what ever reason learning history about our past presidents and the how the period compares to the present period.  Seems like every era has its challenges.  Nice exhibits and an educational movie about A. Jackson's contributions to US History.   It was nice to learn he was the only President to pay down the the national debt to zero.  No other president can claim that award.  The guided tour of the actual house was excellent.  Jack our tour guide was very good at providing more history of the house, its contents and Andrew Jackson himself.  Lunch at the Kitchen Cafe was good as well.  Everyone we interacted with both at the cafe and the property were pleasant and helpful.

name: Nashville Public Square Park
address: Union St & 3rd Ave N, Nashville, TN 37243, USA
reviews: The observation deck here is one of the best views of the city at night. Truly wonderful spot to meet up to start a night out on the town!
Thank you! Nashville for allowing people to enjoy the public square and make events under the safety and security of downtown. Blessed to be a part of it...
Large open space designed for gatherings and festivals. Check out the observation deck high above on the East-side

The park is a great public area right in the middle of downtown, north of Broadway. Love all the fun concerts and events they use the space for! We stopped by on sunday before our flight home and got to try some of the local food trucks as well, perfect way to end the trip. Super easy to get to via tide share as well, or scoot scooting.

This was a nice spot for Live on the Green. The water features are really nice and all of the shade is lovely. If I lived or worked downtown I would definitely come on a regular basis. The festival security did check bags for drinks and they wanted me to pour out my ice water - the guy suggested I refill my bottle inside the park, saying something about a water fountain, but I was there several hours and didn’t see a single fountain at the park. Annoying, but I just bought a $2 bottle of water from the festival vendor which wasn’t too bad.

name: Hatch Show Print
reviews: A fun place to get some more history while you visit the hall of fame.  They give a great history and examples of the different posters they printed over the year and you have an opportunity to make your print as a souvenir!  It's crazy this place has been using the same process for 140 years.

Had NO idea the rich history of Hatch and the parts in history that it played with so many facets of life.  This is a real, living, working piece of history that still plays a vital role in the print communications world!  Very much worth the visit and tour!

Unique tour. Get to learn about the history, process and famous posters created by the Hatch Print company. First half of the tour is in the printing room, second half is in a classroom/work room. You do get to complete a print to take home (the print is nothing special, but still a cool experience). 

You get a 10% discount at the shop after your tour (don't forget to ask for the discount).

We visited TN from FL and this was the only event I chose to book in advance. We bought tickets to the "Block Party" (which lands on the first Saturday of each month during the art crawl). This was really one of the highlights of my trip. We had a little mini history lesson (I could've sat and listened even longer if they let me) before getting to it. The options felt endless, however, we would have really benefited by extending the time at LEAST one more hour. I went home with a couple incomplete projects, but it was still such a fun experience. My husband enjoyed it greatly, as well, and we have since framed our prints. I've told everyone about the prints and the history behind the Hatch Show. I do wish we got a tour with our tickets, even as a voucher to use the following day, as I assumed I'd get to see the old equipment but didn't get to (so make sure to purchase them separately if you want to see that). However, this doesn't take away from the experience as its own entity. I'd even consider paying for smaller group or personal sessions to get to use some type blocks. Thanks for the memory, guys!

A still-active print shop using manual typeface.  You can get behind-the-scenes tours where you can print your own poster! These pictures celebrated the Oscar Meyer Weinermobile and the printing convention going on.

name: Tennessee State Capitol
address: 600 Dr. M.L.K. Jr Blvd, Nashville, TN 37243, USA
reviews: It was great here if you're a Guest. You can Explore Eveeything From Paintings to History. It will be Better if you're in a School Field Trip or A Private Group. In November, We Visited the Second Floor, It was a Great View! We Also went Inside of one of the Rooms Which They made Laws in Them. We Explored All the Floors. After all the Exploring, We went Outside to see the Things in one Path. It was a Much Better Trip than Going Anywhere. It's was the Best trip Ever!

Today we headed to Nashville to advocate for our city. 
Standing for residents and professionals. 
Covering everything from broadband access to taxes to tax sales. 

This year the Tennessee Blue Book is yellow !
Why,  because this year is the 100th year anniversary of Women's Suffrage.  Women were able to vote! African American men were able to vote 50 years later.  African American women followed. 

Meeting with Barbara Cooper (District 86),  Katrina Robinson(District 33),  Joe Towns ( District 84) 

They have a lot of work to do. 
THEY HAVE ALREADY ACCOMPLISHED  SO MUCH!

******Let's support them as they promote us!*******

#TnRealtorDayOnTheHill
LOVED IT! If you are able to be there and take the guided tour do it! So so worth it and this is a beautiful building!
This was a nice family friendly place to go and learn some of the history of Nashville and Tennessee. They do a free guided tour a few times a day and our guide was great.
Very exciting to be able to tour the Tennessee State Capitol. Veterans Day on the Hill 2020

name: Centennial Dog Park
address: 2500 West End Ave, Nashville, TN 37203, USA
reviews: Beautiful park. Lots to do for all ages. The Parthenon was absolutely beautiful. And the paintings they had inside are amazing. Definitely worth the trip. And priced at $6 admission

The dog park was awesome!! They were running around everywhere, but of course controlled. If you are there then pay the $6 to go into the Parthenon. It  is probably the cheapest (but awesome) experience in Nashville. It is the only one in the entire world that is fully restored and built in scale. The bottom entrance is where holly he gift shop and ticket sales are. If you are around downtown I would def recommend visiting it. Everyone is friendly and the guides are free. They also over tours at 2 PM. Hope you enjoy the pics. This, the park, and the Parthenon are all very close together.
Very clean very nice and there's plenty of nice people to talk to! I love the fact they even have people who provide very good and helpful articles from the Bible. It makes you feel safe.

Great ! Historical. Close to farmers market  and state capitol. Pretty, loaded with trees, monuments and a great amphitheater.   A very pleasant surprise!  Free!
Easy to get free parking.

Lovely dog park, varied terrain, plenty of benches, and a walking path throughout.  Overall very impressed with the condition, park is well cared for.  Within walking distance to Centennial Park (about 5 mins on foot/paws).  Separate area for smaller dogs.  People were all super friendly, and dogs were all well maintained/picked up after!

name: Adventureworks Zipline Forest
address: 4129 Whites Creek Pike, Whites Creek, TN 37189, USA
reviews: I feel terrible for not remembering the guides names, but one of our guides had dreads. Both guides were awesome! Professional, and funny. I've never ziplined before so after a few I was pretty comfortable. Line seven was easily my favorite. I'll be back!
Brandon and Landon were the best bookers ever. We laughed great photos lots of fun. Must do . Thanks Brandon and Landon! Grandma from Florida
Liz And Josh were fantastic zip guides. .. Did not realize this place is on the grounds of Barbara Mandrells mansion the Fontanell. Beautiful

Great staff so friendly  
Best time ever 
Would totally  do this again

Place was amazing!! Had a blast! My family from Boston was in town visiting and we took them with us to do the zip line course. The staff was friendly and made the experience worth every penny!!!! I def recommend going and taking the zip line ride!! Knock it off that bucket list!!!

name: The Gulch | Nashville
reviews: Amazing area. I absolutely love the vibe there. All the streets are cozy with modern buildings (or renovated). The artwork on the walls gives a special touch. What I like the most is that this area has tons of great places to eat, from breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner and even drinks at night. Plenty of coffee shops, some clothes shops etc. A must visit.

You're missing our pic. Awesome wall murial. Tucked away in outskirts of downtown Nashville. Had a blast. I'll share the baby wing photo of our family fruitcake. Been traded annually for 15+years. I love Nashville.
The Gulch has the cutest places to take pics. Head up to the rooftop bar at the Thompson Hotel. A great view with great drinks.

A great area to wander around with a camera and take pics! Lots of places to grab a bite to eat and a few high end shops to browse in. Amelia's flower truck was parked on a side street with a beautiful assortment of pretties for sale.
From a local point of view I love the way that is shaping up each and every day. I sometimes drive and feel like I'm on vacation because things have changed so much. I love my city.

name: Fannie Mae Dees Park
reviews: Best park in Nashville, hands down.It's the first park I took my son to. I've been frequenting this park since I was a kid and have loved seeing them transform while also preserving the beauty this little park offers. Take the kids and have a great time!

Fannie Mae Dee's Park is a wonderful urban park for children. There is plenty to do no matter the age of your child, easy access to a variety of sizes picnic tables for packed lunches, and a wonderful dragon mosaic art piece that's impossible to miss! There are swings for big kids as well as bucket seats for infants.
A GREAT PARK for all! Have a picnic, play on the jungle gym, or play at the fort. Don’t forget the historic dragon. It’s a phenomenal piece of history. Ask someone local about it.
Great spot for kids of all ages.  Newly renovated Dragon sculpture is beautifully done and a favorite for the kids to climb on and around.
This was a great park! Very neat, free thing to do. Super cool dragon!

name: Escape Experience - Nashville Escape Games
reviews: It was a great experience! Wish we would have had a little bit longer on the time considering it was the hardest room but otherwise it was a great experience outside the box world things to do on the weekend. Thanks!

We loved this experience....tried to break out of the cell but failed!  Made it about 65% through the escape (just 2 of us).  Would definitely recommend.  Side note....the creativity/realism is simply awesome.
Escaped with under a second left! We had a ton of fun!

Very good escape room experience. We did the C-Block escape and really enjoyed the experience. It had varied puzzles and room to move. 

I wouldn't suggest going with the full 8 person capacity as it may be a bit cramped.
A fun experience for my son and I!  Some interesting puzzles but we didn't escape in time.

name: Treetop Adventure Park
reviews: We really enjoyed this. Felt comfortable and safe. Great adventure!  I feel for a 53 and 55 year old, we did great! Teenagers loved it. It really makes you push yourself to do things you think you can't. When you up there, there's no backing out unless you give up and I'm not a quitter.

AMAZING experience! We took the whole family and every single person enjoyed it. Such a great workout while having a wonderful time! You can stop at any time and go at your own pace. The courses are exhilarating and challenging. The staff was all friendly as well. So much fun!

It is totally irresponsible for you to continue to do business (In MARCH) during this health crisis while we need people to isolate to SLOW this virus down. You put your staff, your guest and the community at risk even with all the disinfecting you are doing. You cannot possibly harness a guest properly or help them into their harnesses without getting up close and personal, much less assist or rescue them.

Park and office staff is great but, cooperate is not they denied my claim for a tree falling on my truck so I need to give a 1 star  its unfortunately we planned to go it least 2 to 3 times year because we enjoyed it so much but sad to say we will not support a company that dont support the customer thank you Gary Denlea Naples Fl

I posted pics of the kids course and the adult course. Our family of seven went zip lining here on vacation and we all loved it. Our seven and nine year old did the kids course, and the guide was nice enough to accompany our seven year old on the course. Our grandparents took pictures from the ground. My other sons ( ages 12 and 14) and mother and uncle (both in their 50s) enjoyed the adult course. The two older adults got off at the half way point for a drink and then continued and finished the entire course. We were there for hours and to top it off, we ended the day by all going on their huge zip line course which was separate from the other courses. It was such a huge zip line that the other side was barely visible. This was worth the money and was fun for the whole family.

name: NashTrash Tours
address: 900 Rosa L Parks Blvd, Nashville, TN 37208, USA
reviews:
I laughed so much my stomach was sore the next day!!! 

Thank you Jugg Sisters, Sheri Lynn and Brenda Kay, for a hilarious trip through Nashville! I didn’t know what to expect but they cracked us all up on the bus with their songs, their one liners, the history of music row and especially their zingers toward certain passengers. It was an enjoyable experience!  I would urge everyone to check them out.  Wish I had bought some merchandise so maybe next trip. 😘

And most of all thanks to John and Darryl for the fantastic idea of getting family and friends together before your wedding.  ❤️

Very disappointing. The reviews state it would be run by two women and it was non stop laughs. That was booked so we opted for the pip show. We got a history lesson on music row,  barely any singing , and very little laughs. It did not match the description or the reviews. It was so bad we got off the bus when there was a break and did not get back on.
The BEST Nashville comedy tour! Pur group of 8 had a blast. Non stop laughs.
Just went on the Nash Trash tour with the Jugg Sisters and I have to say HYSTERICAL.   We started laughing even before we boarded the bus.  If you want two hours of fun it’s definitely a must see
Great ....would recommend to everyone !

name: Riverfront Park
reviews: Although usually a hot destination for tourists, living here affords me the opportunity to catch moments like this when one of the most beautiful and scenic locations in Nashville, is basically all mine! Riverfront Park is home to a very large portion of CMT Fan Fest every summer, as well as many of our great city's major events. In the past it was home to our NYE celebration, and served as home to the 2019 NFL Draft. Be sure to check out our annual 4th Of July celebration here when one of the nation's largest fireworks display is accompanied by the Nashville Symphony along with some of the biggest names in country music!
Nice walk, but some spots can be a little keep your guard up.
I LOVE THE RIVERFRONT PARK. I GO IN THE DAY TIME TO JOG OR WALK THERES LOTS OF PEOPLE AROUND, I FEEL SAFE... I RECOMMEND 💥💥💥💥💥
We were in Nashville Tennessee and we loved it!! Museums, parks , good food and good music. Ready to go back.
One of the neatest urban area parks-complete with a splash pad and rock wall. The old steel bridge is a walking bridge and there are great trails all around to get there by bike.

name: Warner Park Nature Center
reviews: From hiking trails, to the Steeplechase, and all the playgrounds and pavilions in between, Warner Parks never fail to satisfy. We spent our day in the pond behind the nature center, catching tadpoles and salamanders (gently!), and had a blast. Thanks for yet another great day in nature Warner Parks!

Wonderful place to bring children to learn about nature and to hike around. Lots of great trails and a nature playground. Highly recommended. We have been coming here for over 15 years. Lots of memories.
Bring your bike or walking shoes, lots to explore! Well maintained area and it feels safe.

Decent hike if you are looking to just get some exercise in nearby Nashville. There are certainly some pretty spots, but no summits or challenging hikes. It bothered me that I could continuously hear traffic, schools, etc. throughout the hike.
Love this park! The hiking and running is great and the Nature Center is a quaint way to spend an hour!

name: Fort Negley Park
address: 1100 Fort Negley Blvd, Nashville, TN 37203, USA
reviews: This is a fascinating place to visit, however the fort itself is in ruins and what little stonework is visible is walled off with wooden barriers. If you're visiting for the (excellent) view of the Nashville skyline, take the left part of the loop and the trail up to the top of the hill. There are several wooden outlooks built at the top of the fort and with a few shade trees there as well.

Great program presented by  AAHGS of Nashville. Runaways, Coffees and Fancy Girls featuring Bill Gary (book by the same title). Visitors' Centering was easy to locate (Near Adventure Science Center). Nice walking trail that leads to historical markings about the park. After walking the trails, I decided to become a friend and hopefully get involved in the restoration project. I encourage others living in Nashville or visitors to the area take some time to drop in. They also have a staff member on the property to answer questions and programs.

This park is cool and historic, has really cool views of the city. I really enjoyed coming here. I was pretty disappointed though when we arrived and the park was in some significant disrepair. Some of the decking was in really bad shape, and because of that some of the paths and viewing spots were closed off to visitors. Which could totally defeat the reason for coming to the park in the first place. I hope that can be fixed soon.
Cool place but not much to see. Alot of area was blocked off. Rich with history. Great view of the city though.

Really cool and historical civil war era fort. Unlike many other civil war sites in Nashville, this one has it's own modern visitors center, complete with a small theater, gift shop, and exhibits. The fort itself has a well maintained trail around and inside of it. There is plenty of historical signage and information along the way. The views of downtown and surrounding Nashville are the best you'll find anywhere, especially on the north side of the fort. Such a cool site, and as the largest inland fort built in the civil war I am especially glad it has been preserved and can be visited today. This is a great place to bring kids, or history buffs. Also is a must see on the Battle of Nashville driving tour.

name: Nashville WhatLiftsYou Wings Mural
reviews: Tourists love this thing. I don't recall what we were doing in the area but I'm tired of fighting Google about whether I was there. Everyone has their picture taken in front of the wings. Awesome. Have a great time. Enjoy yourselves.

These wings have a very strong reputation in Nashville and around the country. Really cool to see but to wait an hour or more with so many other unique things this town has to offer it is a bit overrated.
