Fellas, let me help you get some time back because your significant other may be one of those that HAS to get this picture... head across the street and get one in 2 minutes... or you can wait in line. Overall this is cool to see but spending more than 20 minutes there feels like a poor choice of time spent in Nashville.
I went during a slow period of the day, but these wings are too cute! You gotta get your picture with them.

Be prepared to stand in line - but not for too long. We loved how kind others were - taking photos for us and we returned the favor. Located near a parking garage entrance/exit so if you are with children be mindful of that!

One of the most amazing cities I've ever visited have gone back twice since first time and then have a third visit planned for the future if you ever get a chance to visit Nashville you should jump on that wagon and ride it all the way down town such a beautiful beautiful place so many attractions close by I mean too many attractions to name off I mean for crying out loud to take you an hour just to walk downtown just just looking around not even going in anywhere museums culture centers just loads and loads and loads of stuff to do what a great little town I really enjoyed visiting definitely going back

name: Music City Escape Room
address: 2416 Music Valley Dr #135, Nashville, TN 37214, USA
reviews: Me, my brothers, and my dad JUST finished the wizard and spells room! Best experience of my LIFE! I would DEFINITELY recommend this place to ANYBODY who likes thrills, has a sense of adventure, and is looking to have lots of fun with family and friends! Our hosts were Jessie and Antonio. They're super nice!

Great escape room. Olivia was "super" great host we felt like real super heroes when we escaped the room with 20 seconds left on the timer. She was great for the time we booked our time to the finish.

I went with my colleagues as part of our management team builder. One half of us did the Japanese horror room (which starts before you get in the room), and the other half did the superhero themed room.  Neither team got out (we were on the very last puzzle), but we had a great time and felt silly when we saw how easy it was to get out. Olivia was our assistant and she was really helpful.

I've done around 20 different escape rooms all over the country. This one is way too basic and too easy. In all ways, choose "The Escape Game" over this!! The price is very similar but the value is not even close! It feels like Music City Escape rooms are just capitalizing on a trend for profit and not putting their heart into making a great experience. The production value was so low and puzzles simple.

I would only go back to try the other rooms if it was $8 per person max.
This was super fun! We didn’t finish our puzzle but it was still a good time.

name: Fort Nashboro
reviews: Cool to see the replica of the fort which was actually not in the same location but close. Didn't care to see all the garbage below the fort on the edge of the river. Hope the city of Nashville takes some pride in their riverfront and cleans it up.

Nashville is a must see! A small city with a plethora of character and charm.  This beautiful little city has an abundance of music and architectural landscaping. The history of Nashville and it’s deep rooted musical connections are something everyone should see. For me, This year, it was Christmas is Nashville. 

Merry Christmas to all and to all a Happy New Year.

We arrived to find all the buildings closed and locked. Don't know if it was a scheduled shut down or what, there were no signs to that effect. But we walked through the fort and read all the signs and enjoyed ourselves regardless. Being in the fort makes you feel like you're stepping back in time. Also got a great shot of Nissan stadium. So definitely put this on your list, just call first 🤣
Nice enough to learn about the local history of the area. Just be mindful of some of the homeless that hang there.

This is a cool little stop off of the beaten path of Broadway. There isn't much there except for the historic log buildings. But, its really cool to have a little piece of history that survived and still being maintained in the downtown area. Its probably not something that I would go to downtown to visit, but if I am walking around it is a nice little side distraction to the hustle and bustle of the city.

name: Shelby Park
address: Shelby Ave & S 20th St, Nashville, TN 37206, USA
reviews: Loved this park! Great for long or short walks. Nice black topped trails, with grass side trails. It was too muddy to try the side trails on our walk, after much rain. Easy to find and close to downtown.
Big and beautiful park. Parking was easy. Everything is green. People from our group could play various active games at same time just by splitting and waking to near locations.

An excellent place to go on a walk and to see the community. The pond in Shelby Park is a place people congregate to fish and chat. There are great walking paths although some turn into roads that are shared by cars. Beautiful wildlife including herons, ducks, fish, and of course everyone’s dogs.
I'm here know doing video and photos.

Kind of a scary once it starts getting dark... Watch about three drug deals go down by the railroad tracks and had two guys on bikes kept circle my husband and I.. will not go back to this park... Bonus it was very beautiful maybe just got there at the wrong time...

name: Cumberland River Pedestrian Bridge
address: Cumberland River Pedestrian Bridge, Nashville, TN 37214, USA
reviews: Breathtaking view. When you take gps here it takes you to a neighborhood, make sure you park across at the Two Rivers Park and walk under freeway to get here. Its about 1 mile, .5 here and .5 back. Worth the view.
Great place for a hike, recommended for all ages, bring your bike and helmet, if you are hiking bring a hat and water as it gets hot and humid on summer.
Pretty cool place to check out and great view of downtown fireworks.
it was hard to get here from my hotel however it seems like it's a very nice park.I was only able to see part of it because one of the bridges is closed.
Very nice and beautiful ride watching the General Jackson roll under us. Be prepared for the ride back up over the bridge.

name: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
reviews:
The Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum in Nashville, Tennessee, is one of the world's largest museums and research centers dedicated to the preservation and interpretation of American vernacular music.

This was a very pleasing visit into the past of our country music. I think any trip to Nashville to explore the roots of country music could not be called complete without a visit to this wonderful museum. 

We really liked this museum. The audio option provides good explanation of exhibits. Provides great overview of country music history. We enjoyed seeing Elvis's "gold" car and piano.

Well worth the money.

Super cool place, but you need alot of time to really see everything.
We were there just for a couple hours before closing, and couldn't get to see the top floor of exhibits in time. They have several interactive exhibits throughout that were pretty fun, like making your own music recording and CD cover art :)
We probably took over 100 photos and weren't even able to get to all the areas. Can't wait to go back one day

One of the main attractions of Nashville and it does not disappoint. There is something for everyone to admire and learn about. My most surprising was Willie Nelson. I got such a kick out of the elaborately embellished suits that the men performed in and such bright colors which I found ironic because we had black and white TVs but it wasn't for us as home...it was for their audience. There is so much more to enjoy here.

What a great way to spend several hours. A whole day could be spent there if you were really into country music. Took my teenage children and they enjoyed the new were displays, however they did enjoy looking at the history of country music. Not only the music, but the cars, instruments and clothing that the artists were during that time. We are intriguing.

Certainly the best place in the world to experience the history of country music, and even if you are not a country music fan, it's worth a visit. You'll see hundreds of historic instruments - the ones played by the legends - as well as costumes, personal belongings, and other memorabilia. Beautiful building and conveniently located in the heart of the downtown entertainment district.

name: Shelby Bottoms Nature Center & Greenway
address: 1900 Shelby Bottoms Greenway, Nashville, TN 37206, USA
reviews: This is AWESOME!!!! Photos may not interest you... get out and take a walk in this Greenway!!! Love it....

Beautiful Nature park with an abundance of trails along the East bank of the river. Walk, jog, bike, and roller blade. You can finish or start your ride on the pedestrian trail and rent a bike at the nature park to ride to the Cumberland pedestrian bridge. Nice green and plush with flora and fauna...I saw rabbits and a family of deer on my bike ride.

Wow!  Super happy to have found this great park!  Great opportunities for hiking and biking. They even have rental bikes so if you are from out of town you can still enjoy a ride.  It’s was really pretty and very spacious, plenty of parking, etc.  get out and stay active while you are on vacation!  Super easy to do it in a place like this!

Nice quiet place in the midst of the hustle bustle of the city. Beautiful views. Walk. Run. Rent a bike. Catch a ballgame (summer) the pond is gorgeous. The river is breathtaking. The nature center is beautiful but I’ve not been inside. The added hands on park for the kids is something I wish were there when mine were smaller. 
It’s worth the stop. Bring a picnic. It’s Nashville at its finest. Plenty of parking.

Great location for photoshoots. This park is an awesome place to get out of the city of Nashville while still basically being in the city.   Some of the trails feel pretty remote.  My friends and I love hiking out there.

name: Nashville Shores Lakeside Resort
reviews: Good place to have alot of fun
Great size waterpark. Fun for all ages. Season pass is the way to go and the souvenir cups are very economical. Best days to go our during the week when school is out. Weekends are always packed...

Funnel cake wasn't good. It was a big soggy donut that wasn't even cooked all the way. Needs improvement. 
Bought 2 of our tickets through Groupon deal. That was the cheapest we found.
Then additional tickets on their website.  Cheaper than buying them at ticket counter.
Nice visit, we enjoyed it! 
Fix the Funnel cake situation please!

The ropes course was awesome, all the people working were very friendly and patient with my 8y/o that had never done anything like this. Everybody received quality personal equipment And a sufficient amount of training to feel comfortable in it. The extensive course give you many thrills and a fairly good workout too, I do recommend this to a lot of people to give it a try you won’t be disappointed.
Water park!

name: 12South Nashville
reviews: Great for walking and shopping. Trendy shops and yummy food choices. It’s a great place to spend some time walking, chatting and enjoying life. It’s easy to get to. Can be crowded depending on the time of year but usually quite manageable and fun!

This was my first time in Tennessee and I was definitely surprised by 12South. It was a very cool strip with a lot of interesting shops. Parking was a little challenging, but walking around was enjoyable.
It's a good thing I don't live near here.  Best ice cream I've ever had! Large variety of inventive flavors.
My old haunting grounds.  Pedestrian friendly and many good choices.  Try out the Muslim center for something different.
Good neighborhood, great people! Easy to navigate and awesome shops to pop you head into! Edleys BBQ was great, excellent place to use the bathroom and refuel!

name: Downtown Presbyterian Church
reviews:
The 95th Holiday Waffle Shop was today and it was awesome.  Waffles with Nashville hot chicken were a favorite of course.  Silent auction and a bake sale too.  Looking forward to next year! 

The church is so rich in history and the Egyptian Revival architecture is fascinating.  A great church to visit on Sunday or during the Nashville art crawls.

An excellent example of the early architecture of Nashville. I was once given a guided tour by a good friend who worked there. They were very detailed in the explanation of the construction and even more detailed when describing the the future plans for the management of the beautiful and well maintained old structure. And of course there were the other stories
... Actual local truths that had occurred and in some way or another had an impact on the church... Or those almost a little too far fetched and possibly a tad bit frightening at the same time, ones that you sincerely hope are entirely fictional, but know full well in the back of your mind that there is a little bit of truth in every story 😬😳

Of course i don't recall any of it really it was an awful long time ago... And i was a lot younger and maybe didn't pay as much attention as i should have to the truely beautiful and interesting things in life like the history behind the Downtown Presbyterian Church. 

So go see some of the old architecture when you're here. They're like a well-kept local secret hidden in plain sight. And please people we've already convinced the poor tourists that peddle taverns are a good 💡 idea, do we have to have a Party 🎉 Fire 🔥 Truck 🚚? Yeah I saw it. 😕It's as real as any of the other constructs in this dimension anyway. 🤷🏽‍♂️ 🤷🏻‍♀️

👽👻👾🤪

For the past few years Everytime we go to Mom's Demand Action Against Senseless Gun Violence in America this amazing church and the volunteer coordinator have treated us like WHAT LOVE LOOKS LIKE! THANKS FOR THE LOVE ❤️❤️💗❤️💗
Beautiful sanctuary. People very warm and friendly.
Good pipe organ music and beautiful  small choir singing on Sunday service at 11:00am. Before service, you can have a cup of coffee to warm up.

name: Off The Wagon Tractor Tours - Nashville Party Wagon
reviews: SO FUN! Off the Wagon Tours was the highlight of our bachelorette weekend! Everyone had a blast and I would recommend the tour to anyone coming to Nashville! Ivy was our bartender/DJ and she was absolutely AMAZING! The staff was friendly and fun and we did not want to tour to end! We drank, danced, played games, and explored the city in style!

Absolutely incredible experience! If you’re looking for a fun time, this is it! Celebrated my best friends birthday and rang in the new year Off the Wagon! We even ended up extended our tour because we were having so much fun! Ivey is amazing and great DJ listens to all your requests. 10/10 recommend and absolutely would do this again next time I’m visiting!

We had a bachelorette weekend for my best friend a few weekends ago and we reserved this Tractor Tour and boy are we glad we did! This was such a fun experience and made our first day in Nashville a day to remember! Shout out to Ivy! She's the best bartender/DJ/photographer ever!!

Off the Wagon Tractor Tour was fantastic!  We had a party of 9 people, was  a perfect way to cruise around the city, drink beer, and listen to great music.  Cory and Ivy were awesome!  Would highly recommend!

We used "Off the Wagon" Tours for our friend's bachelorette party, and although I don't have photos, I can say in confidence that they showed us a great time! We could drink and get a tour of the best areas of Nashville. We played music, danced, sang, and had such a fun time. We will be back to use them again if we come into town.

name: Music City Crawler
reviews: Hunter and Maggie for the win! We booked this on a whim after seeing one of the street, and we can't have been more pleased with that decision (and very happy yours was the first we saw!)! It was so cold the night we went out, but after a few minutes, laughs (and of course drinks) I don't even remember the temperature (hehe). I can't say enough good things, and I hope we get to do this again some time! In the meantime, sharing our wonderful at the Nashville airport with anyone who would listen will have to do! Great job guys, our group of four thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!

James and Ottis were the best in the world, we would hang out with them off duty in a heart beat ;) !!! Started early and spent the morning having the best time ever!! Thanks for making Jen's bachlorette part the best ever!

Hunter and Maggie made the experience incredible for us!! Their energy and positive vibes were infectious. We had an amazing time touring the city, playing our favorite beats and drinking our favorite drinks. Maggie made our music wishes happen, and made sure that our cups were never empty! Would highly recommend this experience to anyone looking for a great time, and I will definitely repeat this if I find myself in Nashville again!

This tour was the highlight of our girls weekend! Hunter &Maggie really amped up the fun for us. They seem to have great chemistry and it looked like they are having almost as much fun as we were. While the reviews seem to indicate they are like this with every tour, they made us feel like we were the best group they had ever had! So much fun and I would go again in a heartbeat next time we're in Nashville!

DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY! 
So unprofessional and rude! 
We had a reservation for a tour this past weekend, and we got a phone call three hours prior saying they had to cancel due to "mechanical issues" with their bike and they did not have a backup. However, then we saw the SAME bike we were supposed to be on out on Broadway at our scheduled time. When the lady called me to cancel she was SO rude and unapologetic about the entire process. She did not once offer a discount for a different time or day. If you don't want your Music city plans ruined, then  DO NOT use this company!!!!

To your response: You gave me an option for a party bus with no discount, AT ALL. I was never once rude or did not hang up on you. I asked you multiple times if there was any other time to reschedule to and you made it very clear there was not and there was nothing you could do other than a refund. I am sorry that you are upset for the terrible review, but giving a rude reply is also not the answer. If your customer service was better then this review would have been different.

name: Etch
reviews: We had an fantastic meal here with friends. The service was outstanding, our waiter was very knowledgeable of the food preparation and menu. They have numerous gluten-free options and the waiter help us navigate this. They have a nice wine list, I had a glass of red with my meal. We started with the GF rolls and cauliflower plate, this cauliflower plate was a treat. I had scallops that were good, the combination on the plate was not my favorite, but the presentation, food, overall experience here is worth a visit.

One of the best dining experiences in Nashville - easy Reservation, lovely atmosphere, fabulous cocktails and delicious culinary creations. Service was attentive. As couples in our 30’s who enjoy fine dining, we did feel the vibe was slightly older and not as trendy as other Nashville spots. We would definitely return if desiring a wonderful meal in this quieter / refined atmosphere.

It's rare that I'll ever give a place 5 stars. Tonight was one of those times.  

I can't complain about any part of my experience.  From the stellar service we received from Jennifer, to the app, to the entree, to the dessert...everything was 100% on point.

Took my wife this past weekend on a long overdue date night. Was greeted promptly by the host. We had reservations at 8pm, we arrived at 730 and was seated within just a few moments. Not expected, but appreciated. We knew that we would have to wait, that would have been fine. The server did  a fine job with the menu review and keeping us "topped off" and tending to any needs. The food was excellent from the starters to the dessert. No complaints at all. Very good. However, and this is on me for not checking the bill closely enough at the end of the meal. There were a couple items added on to my bill that I know we did not order...one of which was a cappuccino. (Neither my wife or I drink coffee). So there was an additional $15 dollars place on my bill that is unaccounted for.  We would go back, just will know to check the bill a little more closely.

Our go to for anniversaries and birthdays. The food quality is always on point. The drinks are perfect and the setting is cozy and intimate. Love how adventurous the chef is and how diverse the menu items are. We always get something different and love it all.

name: TENN
reviews: Well, well, well..we should have gone to TENN for a meal before our last day in Nashville. We stayed at the Holston House Sunday - Tuesday and had a great experience. We loved this hotel the best out of 3 we stayed in on a 5 day trip around Tennessee. My daughter said that was the best biscuits and gravy we had on our trip - and I really enjoyed my two scrambled eggs, toast and potatoes plus a side of bacon that Matteo said was from a local farm nearby. I am so mad we didn't go into the restaurant at this hotel sooner!

Food was amazing,  staff was friendly and welcoming our server was Breck she was so sweet. The omelet was filled with delicious spinach and goat cheese, potatoes were delicious. My husband avocado toast he said it was the best he has had! The bacon is local and so thick and flavorful. Definitely a hidden gem.  The only reason I would not give a 5 star is the coffee is not that great it definitely does not match the quality of food.

Stopped by this restaurant because it was a convenient walk around the corner from our hotel. Making this a MUST whenever we're in town! We had the restaurant to ourselves and go to talk one-on-one with our server, Ricky, and manager, Chanel. They were amazing people to get to know! I can't stress how amazing the service was. I'd come back just to say hi to them. The food to die for — gave you that comfort food style of the south mixed with an elegant flair! Can't recommend this place enough!

I ate here twice while in town and loved the food. The staff was great too!
It’s a great little spot.
A must-try while you're downtown! Service was friendly, ambiance has a cool art deco meets comfy modern feel, and the food is phenomenal. I had possiblity the best meatloaf sandwich I've ever had.

name: Lockeland Table
reviews: Food, service, ambiance, food, drinks, food...all just great. What a perfect place for a dinner with friends. We ordered a lot, and split everything. The spicy pig ears were a standout as well as the pork chop, and the yeasty rolls were magical. I should have opted for the chocolate chip skillet versus the chocolate olive oil cake, but next time! We came here on a Saturday evening and was seated right away in an off small room the ambience was nice the service was average and the food was delicious. Ordered the pork chop & steak with fritters and had a scoop of ice cream. Would definitely come back.

Food was amazing. Had the red Thai curry mussels...they were incredible. Pizzas were also very good. And then dessert. ...oh my. We were a group of 6 so we shared the strawberry shortcake and the bananas foster bread pudding. They were both delightful!! Would highly recommend for a fantastic dinner experience!

A welcoming and casual environment that is serious about food, service, and drinks. Everything we ordered was excellent, but we especially enjoyed the pappardelle pasta and the duck breast entrees. Service was attentive, professional, and friendly. Our only regret was that we didn't leave room for dessert. An excellent dinner!
Lockeland is consistently excellent! Every dish or drink we order is on point and we love! This is our first choice for a random date night and it's never disappointed.

We had appetizers and a fabulous dinner here for a party of five just before Christmas. We arrived about 20 minutes early and checked in. The hostess was super friendly and had our table waiting.  It was cold outside so we were removing our coats when our server offered to take them.  I thought wow now this is some service! The restaurant was already full and bustling with activity by 630. The interior is well decorated, clean and cozy.  We ordered wine and cocktails the server and service was quick and responsive.  For appetizers we ordered the bone marrow, pate, scallops and mussels. Wow! each app was like a favorite to different folks around out table. All were delicious and a couple could easily substitute for and entree! For entrees everyone but one got the ny strip the chef’s specialty. We split the steak and it was plenty for two. Our other party had the duck breast and it was fabulous too.  I believe our servers name was Kelsy. She did a fantastic job serving a five top of foodies!! 
We’ll definitely be going back!

Urban Cowgill 
December 2019

name: The Catbird Seat
reviews: This was an amazing, must-do experience. It was unlike anything I've ever experienced. It's like a series of colorful fireworks displays for your tastebuds. The kitchen staff worked like a well-oiled machine, everyone appearing to work in perfect harmony with one another. The food was exquisite and interesting. From the moment we arrived, every minute was full of surprises.

Oh.my.goodness. What a ridiculously exquisite meal. I wish I could remember every item in detail, but I was too busy savoring every bite to focus on descriptive copy. The entire staff, from host to chef & everyone in between, were kind, skilled, hospitable, fun and delightful. They made our anniversary dinner so special. It was amazing to watch a 12 course meal prepared right before us and they graciously modified a few items to honor my dietary restrictions. If you love food and want a unique & magnificent dining experience, you must dine at The Catbird Seat! It was worth every penny! The music mix was eclectic, yet mixed perfectly with all of the other elements. We will definitely go back.

This was an amazing, must-do experience. It was unlike anything I've ever experienced. It's like a series of colorful fireworks displays for your tastebuds. The kitchen staff worked like a well-oiled machine, everyone appearing to work in perfect harmony with one another. The food was exquisite and interesting. From the moment we arrived, every minute was full of surprises.

The most exceptional meal I have ever had.  A symphony of flavors, textures, techniques, cuisines. A dining experience.  The elements of molecular gastronomy add to the theater of the evening.  
Chefs Liz and Will  won best rising chefs  James Beard Award on 2/26 . I dined there the evening before the announcement.  I wholeheartedly agree.  Kudos

Great food, atmosphere, and experience. New chefs Will and Liz have put a new touch on the Catbird Seat concept and made it a unique environment. They were happy to cater to the vegetarian and dietary needs of our party. Incredible attention to detail! Can't wait to go back. (Picture is before and after dessert "egg" was broken)

name: Husk
reviews: Husk restaurant was amazing. The old house is a perfect spot for a restaurant, so beautiful. Atmosphere was so nice. Location was perfect from our hotel, only a 10 min walk. Food was fantastic. The Shrimp and Grits was to die for. One of the best things I’ve ever eaten. Our server, Logan, was very professional, polite and attentive. We live in Canada, so it may be a while before we return, but if I lived in Nashville, I’d visit this restaurant regularly.

I have been to Husk Nashville a few times, but have also been to the Husk in Charleston. For loving Charleston's food scene so much, I can honestly say I like Husk Nashville more. The building itself makes the dining experience a little different than a normal restaurant, which I personally find very nice. The happy hour is great. You have to sit at the bar, but it's a cool space. The burger is one of the best burgers I've had. Cooked perfectly, with all the right toppings. I have also formally dined here a few times. The menu is constantly changing, with options for everyone. There's usually a vegetarian option too, which is helpful. If you're looking for a special occasion meal, or just to try something new, I definitely recommend trying Husk.

Absolutely incredible! Everything from the service, to the atmosphere, to the food was downright perfect! The dishes were all elevated comfort foods with a signature twist, and my mouth is watering again just thinking about them. The bar area is cozy, and the cocktails were creative and went down easy!! Even the restrooms were spotless! 5 stars all around!

Located in a gorgeous old mansion where there are essentially three rooms: what might have been a small parlor immediately to the left of the front door contained just five tables, a larger room on the other side (kitchen's in back) and a large area downstairs. Best I could tell on my trip to the WC (downstairs), all the tables are four-tops but for two narrow two-tops in the dimly lit parlor area already described.
Subtle and delicious flavors. Creative chef. Parker House rolls are to die for. Very satisfying yet we weren't overly full after. The best meal I've had in a long time.

name: Jeff Ruby's Steakhouse, Nashville
reviews: We made reservations to eat here for New Year's Eve. It was packed! Great restaurant with such a cool ambiance. The bar area has a piano on it with a live band. The service was friendly and quick. The food was simply delicious!! Prices were fair and portions were plenty. The Godfather roll was one of my favorite appetizers. The mashed potatoes and mac & cheese were great table sides. The surf & turf was the best part! We will be back.

I have been to a lot of steakhouses in my time but by far I really enjoyed the steaks at Jeff Ruby's. It was well-cooked it was good quality meat and it was very seasoned well the food is was prepared exactly the way that I liked it. We had a 36 ounces ribeye together and appetizers we had main course we had drinks and we had dessert for a couple of 2 under $150. It was my birthday thank you Jeff Ruby's.

Loved everything from the first step through the door to the last crumb on my plate.  They have a fabulous truffle butter and bread to start which is to die for!  The sushi is super fresh and smaller so it's easier to take in 1 bite.  Great wine list to accompany any meal which was nice.  I got the lemon chicken which was perfectly cooked and moist.  I left super full and had amazing service.
Tremendous experience. Food, atmosphere, drinks, and staff were all top-notch. The raw bar was excellent as well. If you go to Nashville and don't eat here you are messing up.

This is a beautiful restaurant!!  Very upscale and the service was great.  We had the seafood tower and the petite surf and turf.  Both amazing meals, however, the best part was the dessert.  If you go to this restaurant you'll have to try the powdered donut holes with incredible dipping sauces.  Nothing short of amazing!!!

name: Maggiano's Little Italy
address: 3106 West End Ave, Nashville, TN 37203, USA
reviews: This was our second visit to Maggiano's Nashville. We enjoyed this visit more than the last. We had a reservation and although early the table was waiting for us. Staff are attentive and helpful, drinks and food are all served promptly. The food was very well cooked, presented and tasty. Ambiance was very good and the whole restaurant was very busy. Choices were good and well priced, we even got meals to take home included in the price of the original orders. Well done to everyone here. We had a great visit and hope we get to come back soon.

This was our second visit to Maggiano's Nashville. We enjoyed this visit more than the last. We had a reservation and although early the table was waiting for us. Staff are attentive and helpful, drinks and food are all served promptly. The food was very well cooked, presented and tasty. Ambiance was very good and the whole restaurant was very busy. Choices were good and well priced, we even got meals to take home included in the price of the original orders.

This was our second visit to Maggiano's Nashville. We enjoyed this visit more than the last. We had a reservation and although early the table was waiting for us. Staff are attentive and helpful, drinks and food are all served promptly. The food was very well cooked, presented and tasty. Ambiance was very good and the whole restaurant was very busy. Choices were good and well priced, we even got meals to take home included in the price of the original orders. Well done to everyone here. We had a great visit and hope we get to come back soon.

Good Italian restaurant. I have been here a few times and the food has been good. (The reason I keep gong back). I would recommend signing up for their email and you get periodically an email offering $10 off $30 or $20 off $50 so grab a friend and go. They have good lunch specials-complete meal for $10.50 and of course the buy one and take one classical pastas. What I like about that is the pastas that you take are not heated so they are not dried from overheating when you get home. For me, I can easily split a pasta dish and be filled.

Wonderful experience in Nashville. Excellent option if you are staying in one of the nearby hotels. Our server was named Samantha and she had the sweetest demeanor. She was respectful and observant to our cues. On some of the pasta dishes, they send you home with another dish, compliments of the chef. Overall very happy with the experience.

name: Rodizio Grill The Brazilian Steakhouse - Nashville (Dine-In Open May 13)
reviews: This is a great place for people who love to eat. Chicken, lamb, and many different cuts of steak are just some of the different meats that they offer. They also have many sides, gourmet salads and a desert bar! Come hungry because it is an "all you can eat" experience. Fabulous food and excellent service from Lamon!!! He was super attentive to all of our needs! You won't be disappointed!

I have eaten at numerous Brazilian grills but I have to say that this one was disappointing. It started when we walked in and we could see many open tables but it seemed like a challenge for the hostess to find us one. It went downhill from there. We were finally seated and waited, and waited, and waited. Finally we were greeted by a staff member that asked us if our waitress had been over to take our order. She was very apologetic and got us drinks and explained the process of the red and green notifier. We went to the salad bar. It had a pretty good selection and everything there was great. Back to the table and we were asked again by the same young lady if our waitress had come to introduce herself. Again we said no. She apologized again and refilled our drinks for us. Unfortunately that was the last time we saw any waitress. The meat selections were pretty good, but considering the cost we were disappointed with the quality compared to other Brazilian steakhouses we have eaten at. I had to go to the waitress station to get my check and pay it as we were tired of waiting. Overall a disappointing experience. Fortunately this was the first disappointing experience we have had dining in Nashville this week.

An out of town experience for me, I'm from Portland, Oregon. We have a place just like this in Portland, and the food here is better. All the meat was cooked perfectly and seasoned with perfection. A great all-you-can-eat menu for sure. 

I only took off 1 star because the service, while fast and accurate, was pushy. We had less than 30 seconds with the drink menu before she asked us what we wanted. When we said we needed more time, she was back in about 1 minute. With 5 people sharing one drink menu that doesn't work. 

Also, the server was poking fun at us for not eating as much as she thought we should have. I'm sure it was meant to be friendly, but it didn't really come across that way.

Great place for a special occasion or a group of friends! I dined for brunch and it was amazing. Endless meat choices carved at your table! A great selection at the salad bar as well!!! Also breakfast favorites at the breakfast bar! All for around 27$. Great location! Perfect place to leave full and walk it off downtown...

Definitely one of the better restaurants downtown. I love that they have valet parking. The place gets a little busy due to it being in an area where a lot of tourist frequent but if you make a reservation, you shouldn't have a problem getting a table. I love the whole concept of the service. It's like a fancy buffet with servers bringing different types of meat and seafood until you say, I quit with your little green and red block. Definitely a favorite of mines in Nashville.

name: The Stillery
reviews: We traveled to Nashville to celebrate a birthday, so I was looking for a place that could accommodate a party of 14, wasn't super pricey, and of course, had amazing food. For such a large party the service was prompt and accommodating. The mason jar cocktails were delicious, my favorite being the Stillery Sour, and the Blackberry Lime was popular around the table as well. Three of us ordered the Hot Chicken Mac n Cheese, and honestly we could've all split it...delicious but very filling, and lived up to the hype. I can't handle spicy food so I ordered the mildest option, but it was still too hot for me. The wings were very spicy as well, but the catfish was tasty. Since we were upstairs, live music began during our dinner...very interesting type of music on a Thursday night. Overall, it was a great choice, everyone enjoyed the food & drinks, and the service was excellent. Recommend!

Love the drinks options and the hot chicken pizza. The Mac & cheese is a must have but share with the group since you get plenty! There are two floors and both have live music. It's a great way to enjoy the Music City Vibe and try some different food. Great place for locals and tourists.

Great food, good drinks, friendly staff. All the components for a memorable experience. Our server recommended the food and we couldn't have been happier. Catfish was the bomb and my burger was 2and best that I've ever had in my life.

Enjoyed a variety of foods - fried pickles, deviled eggs and ragoons for appetizers. All were very tasty. The last (2) had a mild bite to them, but not "Nashville" hot. Food was great, the moonshine drinks were very tasty, and the service was awesome. We stayed and chatted with our friends for a long time, and even though they were cleaning up - allowed us to continue enjoying our conversations. Great experience, and would definitely go back again.

Good hangout and busy! I had the pizza and it was way too doughy for my liking. Then I ordered the Mac and cheese and it was way too salty. Service was good and drinks were on point. The deviled eggs were very tasty. If I came back I’d get a burger most likely.

name: Midtown Cafe
reviews:
A real jewel and a rear find! Delicious food, fantastic menu prepared to fine dinning standards.  All the staff we encounter were experienced, cordial and more than accommodating. The Lemon Artichoke Soup is legendary in it's own right!
Be aware that sitting is limited and reservations are recommended. Valet parking is still complementary and a great bonus.

I have been coming here for years. I don't go here a lot, but we always seem to find ourselves coming back when we are in town. The food is always wonderful and they offer a shuttle to events downtown. I ordered the Scallops with Lobster Mac and Cheese, which was amazing. My mom had the Shrimp and Grits, which she liked. We shared a bread pudding, which was good, not great, in my opinion. I am a pastry chef and am a little picky. We didn't have a reservation, but we were able to sit at the bar. One thing that most people might like, was that our food came out about 5 minutes after we ordered. We were hoping to enjoy a nice meal there and wish that it hadn't been so rushed. We hung out a while, then ordered dessert, I still gave them 5 stars because we had great food and the bartender is super friendly and attentive. I would certainly go back, since the food is consistently great.

I have been coming here for years. I don't go here a lot, but we always seem to find ourselves coming back when we are in town. The food is always wonderful and they offer a shuttle to events downtown. I ordered the Scallops with Lobster Mac and Cheese, which was amazing. My mom had the Shrimp and Grits, which she liked. We shared a bread pudding, which was good, not great, in my opinion. I am a pastry chef and am a little picky. We didn't have a reservation, but we were able to sit at the bar. One thing that most people might like, was that our food came out about 5 minutes after we ordered. We were hoping to enjoy a nice meal there and wish that it hadn't been so rushed. We hung out a while, then ordered dessert, I still gave them 5 stars because we had great food and the bartender is super friendly and attentive. I would certainly go back, since the food is consistently great.

If you are Nashville and tired of the bar food, looking for a decent meal...this is your spot. Service was perfect...from host to waiter Carlos and nice bartender from New Jersey. Drinks were delicious. Food was outstanding. I had specials (salad and halibut)...delicious!!! We were a party of 10. We appreciated that were very accomodating. And the prices weren't bad. Around $50 a head for cocktails and great food

Well-priced, traditional American cooking in a homey setting. 

I stopped by around lunchtime on a weekday, and the place was bustling but not packed. Friendly, efficient staff. Good quality food at yesteryear's prices. The chicken tenders (pictured) were some of the largest and best-tasting I've had, and that's one of my standard pub-grub dishes. Definitely recommended for breakfast/lunch, I'll be back next time I'm in Nashville.

name: Rolf and Daughters
reviews: Our family was looking for a nice dining establishment for our last night in Nashville. The meals are very good but are basically a-la-cart. They will suggest ordering a green, protein, and dessert. Depending on how many adults are at the table it can add up with multiple greens and proteins in a hurry even sharing the dishes. However, our server was very nice and knowledgeable of the ingredients in the dishes we ordered. It is more like a neighborhood type restaurant and is moderately small. We enjoyed our evening and the food was very good.

Great, local ingredients drive the menu at this hip standby in Nashville. All of the flavors of the South are present and wonderful without the expected heaviness of the region. The outdoor patio has a nice atmosphere, and the nearby greenery adds to the freshness and feeling of being connected to the local flavors. Service is relaxed yet serious, with a great knowledge of what's happening in the kitchen but in no way forced on the diner.

The meals are very good but are basically a-la-cart. They will suggest ordering a green, protein, and dessert. Depending on how many adults are at the table it can add up with multiple greens and proteins in a hurry even sharing the dishes. However, our server was very nice and knowledgeable of the ingredients in the dishes we ordered. It is more like a neighborhood type restaurant and is moderately small. We enjoyed our evening and the food was very good.

We enjoyed our dining experience! Took an Uber, and were promptly seated - atmosphere was very hip, as an open air space it can get loud. We all enjoyed our selections - it is a little pricey for what you get. Cocktails were amazing and creative. Wonderful to see so many unique, homemade pasta options on the menu and the culinary wisdom to pair with selected proteins, herbs and flavors. Definitely glad we went off the path to dine here!

A very nice atmosphere and some yummy food. I really liked this place and would recommend it for a date night. The pasta entrees were nice but I enjoyed the beet dish most of all.
My partner and I did make reservations, but were asked to sit at the bar when we got there. The price point and portion sizes were a bit off.

name: Margot Cafe & Bar
reviews: The food and service is always pretty good here, yet if you really want to go somewhere they'll make your celebration special you might want to go elsewhere. We were happy to get a last minute res for our 20th anniversary on a Sat night, and the girl on the phone when I called knew that's why we were coming. So to only have this mentioned when we asked the server to take a pic, is somewhat surprising.

Place was great, we were the last seating of the evening and had a little bit of a issue getting seated at our reservation time. Kaelyn our server was knowledgable about the menu and had great recommendations. Quality was great and price was affordable. Overall great experience and would recommend it to anyone.

Concierge Matthew recommended this quaint little restaurant. It was delightful and delicious. Server Kristin took excellent care with good wine and entree recommendations. We had olives to share, local lettuce, pear and feta cheese salad, salmon with butternut squash and jalapeño jam pork belly with carrots, hazelnuts and greens. Everything was exquisite! We would want to return our next time in Nashville.

This place is an amazing little gem.  French food is hard to find prepared right.  This place does it.  It's a true atmosphere for a classical restaurant in France.  Nice to have a place like this one in East Nashville.  And bonus the menu changes daily.  Brilliant
Great atmosphere, amazing service. Great food

name: Monell's
reviews: Fabulous breakfast with the best homemade cinnamon rolls and biscuits I have ever eaten. Both are baked to perfection, I could have just eaten those and called it a meal. The rest of the breakfast was just as wonderful with grits, eggs, meats, fried chicken and corn pudding. I don’t think I have ever eaten a more delicious breakfast. Highly recommend!

Fabulous breakfast with the best homemade cinnamon rolls and biscuits I have ever eaten. Both are baked to perfection, I could have just eaten those and called it a meal. The rest of the breakfast was just as wonderful with grits, eggs, meats, fried chicken and corn pudding. I don’t think I have ever eaten a more delicious breakfast. Highly recommend!

I love fried chicken. I saw that Monell's served it Family Style as one of their tasty sides for all their daily seatings of breakfast, lunch & dinner. We were passing through Nashville on vacation on March 14, 2020 and thought why not. We found this "hidden gem" to be located in an old converted residence in part of N. Nashville that appears to be under some rehabilitation and definitely affected by their recent bout with devastating tornadoes.

It was great. Met some friendly people. It truly lives up to its motto "come as strangers leave as family" about 10 people around a table passing food around like Thanksgiving day, getting to meet each other, laugh, and enjoy great tasting food. From ribs to friend chicken cornbread bread pudding potato salad greens etc... the staff was very friendly and helpful. This place a quite the experience and worth the price.

Fun, family style place! Be careful, I ate so much I still don't feel good! Great pricing for what you get, you'll have some fun meeting new people and friendly staff. We're from Minneapolis, met a local and a couple from Chicago and China. All of the food was amazing. Great southern food. My favorite was the catfish. Fresh and not fishy, cornmeal breading was dry and crispy. Great sides and leave room for dessert!

name: Henrietta Red
reviews: One of my favorite restaurants in Nashville! Unfortunately didn't have a chance to try their raw bar menu but the cooked dishes were phenomenal. We had the wood roasted oysters with green curry, the seared sea scallops and the the red snapper. Really liked the kick that the green curry added to the oysters. As for the scallops, they were seared to perfection and the butternut squash ribbons paired delectably well. The red snapper was meaty and tender. The orange butter was super flavorful. Portion size is on the smaller end but I guess it would just allow you to taste test more of their fantastic menu!
We sat at the bar. Matt was great. Cocktails were perfect. Every dish was like a piece of art. Just took in the view before being blown away by the flavor.

The waitress will tell you that you need at least two dishes per person to 'share' and that does make for a fun night, but you need to be really hungry if you order both a first course and an entree to share with a dinner companion. I would start small and add more as needed...their service is super quick. We would have had just oysters and our first course options if we had thought ahead. It can be pricey...but it is just plain good.

Attentive service, good food. Very loud place. Stand out was sunflower seed risotto, even better than the nice red snapper. Octopus salad is delightful. Homemade potato chips were made right, crisp not soggy with very light whipped dip.

Loved the brunch! The eggs and beans dish was incredible and everybody else at my table really enjoyed what they had as well. Not my favorite bloody mary, but it wasn't bad. The mimosas looked great, though. Monkey bread was also amazing for sharing with a group of 5.

name: Butcher & Bee
reviews: Went for Valentine's day dinner with my girlfriend. Really nice vibe and decor. Friendly service and one of the server explained a dish for us as well. The main dishes were good and appetizer was surprisingly delicious! The portion was what you expected at a more chic restaurant: nice but leave you wanting a bit more. The dessert was underwhelming for the occasion. Felt like it could be done for a while and served without much plating. Decent drinks with generous pour. Overall good experience but could be better. Would recommend~

Me and my wife enjoy this place due to the changing menu and that it feels like an experience. We've never had a dish that made us go, "eh it's okay." It's always been amazing and we look forward to the next trip every time we leave. This isn't a place you go to massive portions but rather reasonable ones full of flavor. We love it here.

To start this a Mediterranean-style restaurant - "The Mediterranean diet is rich in lean proteins, like chicken, fish and legumes; fresh fruits and vegetables; whole, unprocessed grains; seeds and nuts; healthy fats like olive oil; and a limited intake of dairy and red meats." The environment boasts a slick interior that screams "Hip and Cool", which comes with a premium in price. And the food is bomb. I had the Hummus and Avocado Crispy Rice (added the shawarma chicken thigh to the rice dish).

This was overall a really good experience. Bar was set really high and it delivered on most expectations.

The restaurant itself was beautiful.  Really nice overall package here. Highly recommend sitting at the open kitchen.

Service was good. Our server was really knowledgeable on the menu and pretty attentive.

Drink menu was also really good. So much to choose from.

Food itself was excellent. Presentation was good. We liked about 2/3 of what we ordered, which is really good. Whipped feta is a must.

Wow, what a creative menu and space. Menu changes and has a Mediterranean fair, we had roasted cauliflower, Israeli fried chicken, and roasted carrots. Everything was delicious with lots of of different seasoning. The fried chicken was the star, super crisp and moist and not your Nashville hot chicken! Drinks are also very creative with lots of different flavors. We'll be back!

name: Skull's Rainbow Room
reviews:
Simply amazing food and service...not to mention music!  I ordered the duck and it was perfect.  Crispy skin and oh so tender and flavorful.  The lobster bisque was silky and had tons of flavor.  

I sat at the bar and the service was attentive but not overbearing, friendly and helpful, and felt like I was at a neighborhood bar. 

Great band playing ad well and it generated a vibe throughout the entire place.

We had such a wonderful experience! The management team should be proud! Tori, got us in on a cancellation reservation and we had what I think was the best seat in the house for the show. The food was amazing, our server was incredible. The entire staff helped each other out. I received food and drink recommendations and was checked on many times. The show and music was amazing. Keep it up, you guys are amazing. BEST IN NASHVILLE

We stopped in here for a drink as we planned to sample the bars along Printer’s Alley. We were not disappointed. We walked in and it was dark and sultry, and a pianist was playing some awesome jazz. We were able to stand near the bar, get a drink, and absolutely enjoy everything around us. The sights, the sounds, the smells - the food looked amazing!! I can’t wait to go back!

I completely cherished everything about this spot! The nourishment decisions are restricted, however it's well justified, despite all the trouble. I was unable to pick between the pork hacks and the fish extraordinary of the day (sword fish with shrimp) and I requested that our server shock me. I'm happy she picked swordfish for me since it was totally flavorful. I would prescribe reserving a spot. We had 8PM reservations on a Sunday and was situated promptly, and wound up remaining until near to 12 PM. The mood is in no way like what you would consider when you consider going to Nashville yet it is a GREAT change from Broadway. I'd go to Nashville again and avoid the entire Broadway strip to come directly to the back street and eat at Skull's Rainbow Room. Our server's name was Sarah and she offered remarkable assistance!

We wandered into Skull's one night after midnight. Most of the dinner guests had departed but the action around the bar was still shakin'. Within minutes of getting our drinks we felt that we had known the bartender and bar back for years. Both Levi and Pearce had just the right amount of confidence, hospitality, smoothness and sage wisdom. Not every bartender wants to serve every guest. I could easily read between the lines that Levi was a professional and even if you were an a**hole he would treat you right.

name: M
reviews: I had the pork shank and wife had raviolli (with chicken due to allergy)... both were great. Staff was attentive but a little slow. We were there right when they opened so they were still getting it going for the night but it was good. Alex was our server and he was great. Bread pudding was to die for...go just for that and it is a great night.  Meals were exceptional, outstanding wine selection, very comfortable atmosphere. Highly recommend for a relaxing dinner!

As a Nashville Native this place has seemed to be around for forever, so we decided to give it a shot since we’d never heard anything from anyone we knew about the place. And it was a very good decision. It seems much more like the Nashville originals of yesterday (and that is a huge compliment). Our service was very good and attentive along with delicious food. The ambiance is a bit open but still comfortable. We had the bone marrow app, I had the paella and my friend chose the vegetarian dish. They were all delicious! We will be back. A great place for couples/groups as well.

Where do I begin? I will start with the food since that is the first thing people look at. Everything was exceptional! We had the following - Hot Chicken and Waffles, Fried Green Tomatoes, Shrimp and Grits, Crab Cakes, Seven Fish of the Sea, Tortellini sub Chicken as the meat, a special request Reuben, and chocolate creme brûlée. 

The shrimp and grits were by far our favorite. I am a bit picky after having what I considered the best in Charleston until I found this place. I highly recommend everything on the menu, but especially the shrimp and grits. The hot chicken and waffles were such a great starter. It had a perfect heat and sweetness. The fried green tomatoes also had a light heat and blend of flavors and perfect crunch. 

I can’t say enough great things about the food. You can’t go wrong here, and don’t be afraid to ask your server for something special. The Reuben is only on the menu for lunch, and our friend wanted chicken on the tortellini, which was also fantastic, and our waiter was extremely accommodating and had great suggestions. The chef and manager also came over to make sure everything was perfect. 

This was an all around amazing experience. We will be back!

As a Nashville Native this place has seemed to be around for forever, so we decided to give it a shot since we’d never heard anything from anyone we knew about the place. And it was a very good decision. It seems much more like the Nashville originals of yesterday (and that is a huge compliment). Our service was very good and attentive along with delicious food. The ambiance is a bit open but still comfortable. We had the bone marrow app, I had the paella and my friend chose the vegetarian dish. They were all delicious! We will be back. A great place for couples/groups as well.

Meet Nashville's Newest Rock Star in the Culinary world. Head Chef Frank Tidwell  at M. Restaurant and Bar in downtown Nashville gives you an ALL IN experience. Great service, great vibe, and the food is beyond words.  You can taste every ounce of passion that is used to create these delicious and unforgettable dishes.  So come in relax and let Chef Frank and his All-Star staff take your taste buds on a Roller Coaster ride of pleasure they won't soon forget.

name: Sperry's Belle Meade
reviews: Great service paired with fantastic food. Reservation are definitely recommended. We were seated immediately and the staff was very attentive. Steak was cooked perfect for my taste (medium rare). My wife ordered the halibut and it was tasty as well. This is a place that I would recommend for special occasions as dinner bill can get expensive, but every bite is worth the price.

The food here is excellent.  They are by no means on the cheap side but you get what you pay for here. The salad bar is long fresh with multiple selections.  It can get loud as the place is small.  The servers here are top notch and we have never had an issue with service.
It's a must to try the their steak when you are in Nashville and the food is great. One serving is enough for two person and you can split it.

I would like to thank Mark, the manager at Sperry's Belle Meade. There was a mistake on our take-out order and the person who was taking the order was not apologetic and had no idea what he was doing. Mark, however, handled the situation very well. He knew what he was doing and he was so apologetic and kind for the mistake that happened. Honestly if it wasn't for Mark I would not be going back to Sperry's at all. Thank you Mark for doing your job exceptionally well!

One of my favorite restaurants! I love the ambiance, the service is impeccable and the steaks are melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Reservations are a must. Parking is tight, but  valet parking is available. Dress is casual, but definitely not messy. I wore jeans and a nice sweater. Even if you don't normally order dessert, have their signature peppermint ice cream with chocolate sauce! It's the perfect ending to a delicious meal.

name: The Wild Cow
address: 1100 Fatherland St SUITE 104 11/22, Nashville, TN 37206, USA
reviews: I myself am not fully vegan, but my girlfriend is, so I brought her here as a treat and BOY HOWDY was it! Heck, I think I liked my French dip sandwich way more than any non-vegan ones I’ve ever had! The service was great and kind, and the space is laid back. We even had a bit of a spill and one of the servers, Ash, was super sweet and gracious to us. Definitely hope I find myself there again some day!

Today I went on a lunch date with my friend and a friend and boy did we have the surprise of our lives! We shared the Nacho appetizer and it was to die for! We each had a different entree and my friend did not want to talk the food was so good! What we experienced today was healthy food with out of this world flavor x 10! The only regret that we has was not coming sooner! Thank you Wild Cow, you are my new go to vegan establishment!

Wild Cow is my favorite restaurant. I live in Portland, OR but luckily I have family in Nashville. When I visit we always make a point to go. I’ve never been disappointed in anything I’ve ordered here. Last time, my mom and I both ordered the beans and greens bowl with tofu. Now we’re each trying to recreate it at home.

Wild Cow, please come out with a cookbook! Or maybe post a few recipes on your website? 

The new location is more spacious and comfortable. We love it!

As a vegetarian trying to become vegan, I need more places like this closer to where I live. The food is absolutely delicious. And not even compared to regular meat and cheese. Just delicious period. Paired with a friendly atmosphere and kind staff, this place is a must for vegetarians and non-vegetarians alike!

Ate here twice during a recent stay in Nashville.  The server (I cannot remember her name unfortunately) was fantastic during our first visit!  She answered all of our questions about the menu and made recommendations.  She was clearly very knowledgeable about the menu and veganism in general and was extremely friendly and helpful.  She definitely made eating here a pleasant experience.  The food was fantastic!  Generous portion sizes and great flavors.  There were lots of options to choose from and many gluten-free choices too, which is fantastic.  The restaurant itself also had a lively atmosphere and was clean, bright and modern.  I can highly recommend this restaurant for the health-conscious vegan or otherwise as there is something for everyone.  Wish there were more restaurants like this in the States!

name: Darfons Restaurant & Lounge
address: 2810 Elm Hill Pike, Nashville, TN 37214, USA
reviews: This is one constant for excellent food and service. Get there early as lots of other foodies know this place. Had a wonderful old fashioned to begin. Luke was server and right on time with suggestions and service. The wine by the glass selection here is tops! Decided on the grouper special, it was excellent. nice Chardonnay by the glass and another wonderful experience was in the books.

We were on our first trip to Nashville And when we were driving to our hotel we got the munchies and decided on this place because of good overall Google reviews.  The service was good..  Everyone we interacted with helpful.  The food was plentiful so you may want to split a dish if you are not too hungry.  In our case, we took the left overs back to our room and ate the rest as another meal.  As you can see from the picture the food was delicious.  I would recommend the fried chili garlic grits if you like grits or even if you don't.  Recommend this place for a nice delicious meal and good service.

You enter into a relaxed environment where the mood is set to lead to a great evening.  
Fine dining feel and the food to match the vibe, the drinks were also delicious.  The menu changes often, so prepare for a new and great experience every time.
We had appetizers, steaks, a touch of everything and not one person at our table left unhappy or displeased.
Delicious experience start to finish.

This place has been here forever and it is clear to me why. Our friends invited us out and it being their fave we decided to give it a try. WOW!  Greeted at the door by friendly staff and seated quickly. Atmosphere was relaxing, warm, and comfortable. Waiter, Josh, came by quickly and took care of us with skill and care. The food was amazing.  Will put it on our GoTo places to eat.

Steak prepared perfectly, loaded potatoes a must, with grilled asparagus.   A real taste treat for all the senses.   Service was top notch, too.  Hector went the extra mile to help the bartender prepare a Smith and Kern's after dinner liquor.  The perfect way to end a perfect meal.

name: Bakersfield Nashville Temporarily Closed
reviews:
Bold flavours!

The tacos at Bakersfield were some of the best I’ve ever had outside of Mexico! The flavours were bold & bright, and the tortillas were authentic. The margaritas were great as well, nice & strong! I really appreciated the service platter that the tacos came out on, it made the meal feel more communal. The only downside was the lack lustre service, but it was busy so that was likely a factor.

Really good mexican food in Nashville. We can here for early lunch and our bartender, Marshall, was just awesome. He really made the meal fun for us and provided great recommendations. It's always better sitting at the bar when the bartender is able to bring an element to the experience. Definitely recommend!

Hot spot for elevated tacos. Enjoyed the hongos taco as a vegetarian option. Roasted cauliflower was delicious. Fairly priced. Excellent service and food was delivered very quickly after placing order. It's typically busy and a bit noisy so maybe not the best for quiet conversations but great for pretty much any other occasion.

Do you see these tacos? They are just as delicious as they are photogenic. The drinks were stellar. I had the spicy pineapple margarita - whew...first couple sips open your sinuses but after that it's smooth sailing. I love the atmosphere of this spot. Community tables. Very chill. Love the decor and the service was great! Will definitely come back.

Great bar staff! Thank's for the stellar drinks, and awesome recommendations on where to execute our super fun rooftop bar crawl. And we returned later for the great taco menu.  Bakersfield is modern,  relevant and active Nashville! Must go!

name: The Chef And I on Ninth
reviews: A fantastic experience for any food fanatic. The food was all A++. I highly recommend the 5 or 7 course tasting and sitting at the chef bar on your first visit. The experience is like having a personal chef prepare your meal in front of you. The atmosphere is unique. It is a blend of bar and fine dining. The service is also top notch. Everyone there is super friendly and attentive. All of the dishes were well explained and brought at well timed intervals. If you like trying new things, experiencing fine dining, or want a unique experience then this is the place to go.

Although I have been to The Chef and I, my friend has not . This place is always packed so I planned ahead and secured a spot for two at the counter. This is entertainment and dining all rolled into one. He enjoyed watching the organized chaos of the chefs and their kitchen dance - you can be interactive and ask questions about techniques and ingredients as the meals are cooked . I had sable fish over pearled couscous- a first time for this fish and it was fabulous . Although there is technically kit a “bar” the servers are very attentive and make sure your glass is never empty. This is a lively place and has good energy .

Make sure to make a reservation. We came here on a Friday night and sat at the chef's table. We had the taquitos and crab and lobster bisque for app, both were delicious and portions we're generous. I wish I had stopped at that since I was full at the end of our app course. Then for the main dish we ordered the short ribs and the duck. They were both phenomenal dishes. The short ribs was super tender and delicious with lots of meat (10+ oz) and potatoes. The duck was made just perfect with pink hues all inside and crispy skin on the outside. The duck came with a large portion of potatoes+cheese combo, so you'll for sure be full just eating this dish alone. Eating at the chef's table is a must since it's entertaining and a fun date idea.

Some of the best food you can eat. Seriously. Strongly suggest you sit at the chefs counter in this open kitchen concept as you'll enjoy the amazing skills the chefs show as they make your food. 

The cocktails are awesome and made to perfection. The 5-7 course tasting menu is a must and will give you a good idea of the range they have to offer. If you're in Nashville be sure to make reservations!

I liked this place a lot. It is very small and I understood that they are doing a course menu if you would like to sit facing kitchen and you have to reserve your spots. Their menu is very easy to understand. One of the most memorable appetizers and awesome presentation was Cauliflower with goat cheese! Elk tenderloin was very good too.

name: Marché Artisan Foods
reviews: This is a real gem in East Nashville. I love visiting this place for brunch. It’s local, unique, and packed full of flavor. They are always changing up the specials which I enjoy that keeps me wanting to go back. Get there early or expect to wait, but waiting is totally worth it.

This place is amazing, a gem away from tourists with amazing service, ambiance and food; best find in Nashville. Jessica our server was amazing, a beautiful lady, super patient (as i had foreign family with me which required translation). Quality of foods and beverages was phenomenal. Feels like you are in a little french bistro.

This place is amazing, a gem away from tourists with amazing service, ambiance and food; best find in Nashville. Jessica our server was amazing, a beautiful lady, super patient (as i had foreign family with me which required translation). Quality of foods and beverages was phenomenal. Feels like you are in a little french bistro.

Marché is always amazing. This time I had the sweet potato which was incredible with two eggs on top. The crispy bacon side is excellent and I love greens in the AM. 

The Americano was perfection. 

It does get noisy inside, so if you’re looking for a quiet place, this isn’t it. 

I’ve also had oatmeal here and breakfast type sandwiches. 

No one is ever disappointed. 

Thanks !!

This place is amazing, a gem away from tourists with amazing service, ambiance and food; best find in Nashville. Jessica our server was amazing, a beautiful lady, super patient (as i had foreign family with me which required translation). Quality of foods and beverages was phenomenal. Feels like you are in a little french bistro.

name: Puckett's Grocery & Restaurant - Downtown Nashville
reviews: Ordered a Piggy Mac and some other stuff including sides of mashed potatoes. The pork that was in the piggy Mac was dry and tasted like it was days old and the mashed potatoes were terrible. It tasted like they were making the mashed potatoes with water instead of milk. Been working in restaurants for years and I could tell there was no milk in them. That’s absolutely disgusting. During these tough times you should be raising standards and giving your best possible product. Not lowering standards and cutting corners to make an extra buck. Very disappointed. Better places to spend my money right now.

Philly brisket sandwich was awesome! Good thing I don't live here or that would be my go to! Ordered that and a greens salad with chicken salad added. Chicken salad was also awesome. Size of greens salad was questionable.  Very small for 10 bucks. I saw someone eating a salad at the bar and it was a huge bowl of greens. The portion I got was not.
I ordered food at the bar,  while I waited I had a beer. The people on either side of me had there food before I got mine and they sat down 15 or 20 minutes after me. The bar tender apologized for the delay, but never offered any compensation.  It would have been a courtesy to comp my beer or something small to make up for my 45 minute wait for my food.

Puckett’s is amazing. It’s the feel of Nashville that’s family friendly and always hits the spot. They have a dog friendly patio on a nice street downtown. The food is great and they have Yazoo beer (a Nashville local and favourite beer). They are always busy, because they’re great so be sure to call in advance to put in a reservation. They also have late night live music which we haven’t yet seen but notice when walking by at night. This is always our very first spot to eat when visiting town.

Thought the idea of a grocery store turned restaurant would be cool to see, so I went.  It was alright, but nothing special.  Was loud and when music started, even louder, which would be expected, so that didn't really bother me.  The music was not good the night I was there.  I am sure that's hit or miss.  Food was so so.  Overall, the experience was average.   I don't see me going back.

Southern comfort food without all the pretentiousness and high tourist prices. Reece was our server. He was courteous; food come out in record time, which was great because we were hungry.  Highly recommend it, particularly if you are staying anywhere close to the library as is within walking distance.

name: Peg Leg Porker BBQ
reviews:
Missed reviewing Peg Leg Porker BBQ. All of the barbecue places we visited while in TN, were based on what the internet gave as the best reviews according to customers, magazine articles, etc. 

Peg Leg Porker BBQ is a very casual place with informal seating and self service, in that you go in, order your food, pay, get a number, and pick it up at the counter when your number is called. You sit where you like while you wait, though the wait is brief. The bar is at the opposite side of the room, and you order your drinks to bring them back to your table. There seemed to be a regular customer clientele seated here. 

On my companion’s quest for great barbecue while in TN, this was on the must visit list. We ordered a rack of ribs to share and the mac and cheese side along with crinkled fries. The dry rub and the ribs were good. The sides were average. Tables with students and seniors appeared to be having a good time whether eating ribs, pulled pork or wings. The prices are reasonable. 

There is a lot of brand merchandise for sale for customers who love this place or visitors who choose this as a destination place. Worth the visit if you're visiting multiple barbecue places to find what you consider the best. 
.

Stayed at the Hutton Hotel (excellent) and the valet suggested this place. The ribs were served dry which "let's the meat speak for itself." It did and what a statement. The meat was tender, juicy and tasty. This place is a keeper and next time through Nashville I will be there again. Take friends with you. They take reservations for groups. Beats the wait in line. Ran out of ribs but the chicken was great. Pork was also outstanding. Mac and cheese and smoked green beans are a must. Sat upstairs and apart from the nachos taking awhile the service was great.

Basing this off of a single delivery meal of ribs, beans and slaw, but it was that good. While there a some other good bbq shops here (Central, Edley's & Martin's), this is among the best I've had in Nashville. I will definitely be ordering again to try more of the menu.

This place had a line of 20 people when it opened at 11am!!! But after eating here I know why. The pulled pork was the best I’ve ever had... no fat and perfectly cooked pork. My husband had the ribs and they literally fell off the bone. Prices are reasonable and portions are generous!

Our office has ordered catering from all of the BBQ Restaurants in Nashville.  As much as we like all of them, we keep coming back to Peg Leg Porker.  As a matter of fact, all  of our employees prefers Peg Leg. The food is always delivered HOT, as well as, top-notch quality and the quantity is always plentiful.  They always provide more than enough food.  Their catering service is also top-quality.  They never disappoint.  If you are looking to have BBQ catered to your home or office, I would highly recommend Peg Leg Porker.  Believe me, you will not be disappointed.  Plus, they are a family owned establishment, not a chain, and it's always good practice to promote our local restaurants.

name: Five Points Pizza East
reviews: We went a bit too late to try the Stromboli and garlic knots. We did order a few slices from the walk up menu after 11:30pm on a Monday night and it was quick. We ordered a pepperoni slice and a meat lovers. I only have a picture of the meat lovers because we both devoured the pepperoni. It was our favourite! I wouldn’t be lying if I said that the pepperoni slice is in my top 3 all time best pizza I’ve ever had! Good job!!

Hands down my favorite pizza place in Nashville. The crust is always the perfect consistency and cooked to perfection. The flavors are great. Perfect for any night or get together. Great location in a fun neighborhood. Service is also great. Can’t wait until I come back!

No photos because we were so hungry 😋. My daughter doesn’t like BBQ so on our way back to Chattanooga we stopped at this place that was recommended. We went to the take out side and ordered three slices. In a few minutes we were back on our travels and ate yummy pizza. The cheese was excellent and dough soft. We will be traveling back to Tennessee in a few months and will visit their sit down location soon!

Terrific pizza
We saw customers buying takeout pizza as soon as the store opened at 11 am so we had an inkling that the pizza was good.  We went back at lunch time and ordered just a slice to try.  That one slice became three slices, arugula salad and garlic knots with hot marinara sauce.  It was just delicious - thin and crispy base with minimal toppings!

Went there short line. There was a guy that had ordered a head and was waiting for his name to be call, but didn’t know apparently you have to get in the order line when you arrive then move to pick up line. Very confusing and the guy was not thrill. The order taker was nice. The guy that called my name and lay my order on the pick up was unfriendly. Also, I heard another employee say “ Tony bologna.”  As my name is Tony. First, I started to say something real ugly but I let it slide. The guy was ugly as hell and look like some Bologna. I would have went in on him for being ignorant.

name: The Standard
address: 167 Rosa L Parks Blvd, Nashville, TN 37203, USA
reviews: I've been to a lot of good restaurants and I have to say this one is one of the best I've been to. The service was top notch, ton of history, great ambiance and amazing food. Rarely write reviews but felt compelled to after a great experience here. Our waiter Sean was amazing and the hostess Mrs. Smith was such a sweet heart. Highly recommend

I dropped in for a members luncheon in February and had the distinct privilege of meeting Josh and Jerry and hanging out at The Standard that afternoon. What a fantastic place, truly unique and the food was absolutely incredible! This is a MUST STOP for anyone visiting Nashville!!! I will not be back to Nashville without first making a reservation here! Truly the BEST OF NASHVILLE!

One of the most amazing experiences.  If you have not tried this gem, it is a must.  First off you are greeted by the most amazing hostess I have ever met.  Such southern hospitality.  She is such a mom, which makes the experience so beautiful as it was.  We were greeted and introduced and taken to the bar to sit before we had dinner.  The bar atmosphere is so beautiful.  The whole restaurant is breath taking to begin with.  I have not even gotten to the food.  We were seated, and she kept checking on our dining experience the whole time.  The food melts in your mouth.  A must when you come to nashville!!  Many know about it, our first time.  I would come back...just to experience "mom" again.
