Such a beautiful soul and thank you for making my birthday so amazing as you did.  I felt I was at home.  13,000 sq foot facility...looking at the front of the home you would never know.

This is a must visit while in Nashville! 

The bar has a great selection of whiskey and wine. It’s a cozy bar with a fireplace, unfortunately live music wasn’t an option the night I visited. 

Was too busy eating the rest of my meal and didn’t get more pics. The sampler appetizer isn’t listed on the menu but it’s a must order; fried green tomatoes, calamari and the low country shrimp. The Standard Filet....  nothing more to say, order it and thank me later!

What a great place! Great food (with an accmpanying price!) great atmosphere, great service, and a unique location. The Standard is located at the Smith house and is the oldest building in Nashville. There are tons of cool nooks and crannies, including a hidden room behind a brick wall!
Excellent place to go for dinner, drinks, or just to relax. Highly recommended.

name: Arnold's Country Kitchen
reviews: We were scared away by the long line at Biscuit Love, so we took a short walk over to Arnold's. All members of our party were weary and hungover, and the food absolutely hit the spot. The pulled pork, mac and cheese, and fried tomatoes were to die for and were served cafeteria-style by helpful and cheery employees. The whole plate and a large sweet tea cost ~$13, a great value. Loved it!

Hands down some of the best Southern food I've had. The experience was just fantastic. Staff and customer service: hands down what food service should be. Now the food...the banana pudding was pretty sinful. And I can't tell you the last time I had fried catfish but I guarantee you it didn't taste like this did. It is worth the line. It doesn't take long. They move very quickly and diligently with ordering. Trust me. Just try it.

We were scared away by the long line at Biscuit Love, so we took a short walk over to Arnold's. All members of our party were weary and hungover, and the food absolutely hit the spot. The pulled pork, mac and cheese, and fried tomatoes were to die for and were served cafeteria-style by helpful and cheery employees. The whole plate and a large sweet tea cost ~$13, a great value. Loved it!

This place is awesome. The food was top notch. Went late at 1 pm to avoid crowd, didn’t happen. Huge line all way out the door. Bbq chicken sold out while I was eating. Recommend this place and going early!!

We found this restaurant on an episode of Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives and saw it had thousands of 5 star ratings. It was humble but the ratty parking lot was full even though it costs $5 to park. We were greeted warmly and told how to order (cafeteria style - grab a tray and walk through the line). We tried foods like collard greens and grits and loved them both. The fried chicken was amazing. It is quite possibly the best food I have ever had. I also enjoyed the cafeteria seating sitting next to smiley strangers at long tables in the crowded room. No one gasped when we prayed over our food. We will be back!

name: Josephine
reviews:
What a great Venue, since the moment we sat down until our departure. 
Service was on point. Our meal was just amazing. One of the best meal I had in Nashville so far. Wine, drinks and most of all food. Good job Abbey 😊
Complementary valet parking or pay to park around the corner. We left talking about when can we make our next visit. Cheers!! 😁🤙🏼🤙🏼

Delicious food, great atmosphere. My wife and I had brunch there on a Saturday, late morning. The pistachio sticky buns we're sticky and tasty. The leek and mushroom quiche was twice as high as expected for "one" slice and tasty, too. But the dried cherries and orange brussel sprouts were awesome!! Hope to go again when we go back to Nashville.

So much to love. Surrounded by a beautiful restaurant you'll be treated well by a welcoming staff. Food is delicious. Couple of highlights are the beef tongue, and papperdelle. Chicken for 2 was filling and fantastic. The place has the whole package and I'm excited to return.

Josephine has one of the top teams in Nashville.  From the time you walk in the door you feel welcome and relaxed.  The lighting is perfect and the setup is cozy yet chic.  The menu has a some staples, one of which is the chicken for 2 which is always spot on.  The seasonal additions are always a fun way to try something new.  Each dish is beautifully prepared and there is a good balance of veggies with every entree.  Dessert is a great addition with both seasonal specials and classics like the apple cobbler.  I feel right at home when I have dinner here and always look forward to the next visit. And don't forget your ginger snap cookies which are a special treat handed to you on the way out!

Beautiful setting and trendy neighborhood.  Had the Winston cocktail which was a good bourbon based old fashioned drink. Had the beef tongue; good flavor with the caramelized onion.  Though I expect the beef tongue to be slices instead of shredded.  I would be more impressed if it was sliced and sear.  Scallop was perfectly cooked but the okra was a bit overcooked which was hard to chew.  Overall great place but not blown away.

name: Peninsula
address: 1035 W Eastland Ave, Nashville, TN 37206, USA
reviews: We were thrilled with the pacing of the dishes! We have been to a number of tapas restaurants here and in other parts of the world, and have usually been disappointed in many dishes brought out at the same time. Maybe because they're so small, they can really take care of the customers, and this care shows and is so appreciated! The cocktails are tasty, and if you're a G&T fan (I'm not), there's a large menu just for those. Yes, the food portions are fairly small, but the tastes are fantastic! I won't list the dishes we had, since they'll always be changing. We're definitely going back, probably seasonally, to continue to enjoy their culinary magic. Service was so friendly and attentive - loved it!

Such an amazing place. If you want a dining experience and not just eat dinner, this is it. We were really impressed that Craig brought his passion for this place to the front of the house!

Loved the shared dish style of service. The Grouper with horseradish foam was our fav, but the rabbit, and pork cheeks were super tasty as well.

Killer cocktails that blew away our pre dinner drinks at Attaboy. Great G&T menu. The housemade amaro was super tasty.

We rarely get to double back on places to eat/review, but this would be one of those places.
SAVOR- 5 out 5

Such an unique experience.  Make sure to check out the BTB wine list... for an amazing collection of old and new, interesting and special wines. "Peninsula" for the Iberian peninsula, bringing extraordinary bites from Portugal and Spain with an experienced twist.  Absolutely a must for the most adventurous among us!!!
Peninsula is divine. Well thought out wine list, amazing cocktails and the food is off the charts. Get the rabbit stew...you will not be disappointed. Delicious. And save room for dessert.

Exceptionally unique and beyond delicious dishes. All dishes came in a form that we weren't expecting at all.  The chef here deconstructs and rebuilds the dish a unique way. We were pleasantly surprised with the form of almost everything. 

There should be a popup store that sells only the rabbit stew + toasted croutons. That dish still has me dreaming about it.

On the negative side, I really didn't care for their take on pan con tomate. It has this heavy aioli/mayo that really weighs down the start to a meal, and the sesame seeds annoyingly get stuck in your teeth without adding much to the dish. 

We loved the lobster, adding bonito on top gives a great umami and the crunch of the cracker contrasts the otherwise soft elements. 

The cauliflower was really one to noodle on. Would have expected the scallop to be the main component but it's dried and ground almost as a  breadcrumb on top. The flavors were so spectacular, definitely order this. 

My wife is still glowing about the crema catalana ice cream. Sweet, salty from the potato chips and caviar, crunch from the bruleed sugar. It was everything. 

Highly recommend this place, so happy to see creative cooking in Nashville as opposed to the monotony of southern family style cooking restaurants.

name: Chauhan Ale & Masala House
reviews: We really enjoyed the food and ambiance at this restaurant. We love Indian food and weren't disappointed by this more modern take on traditional Indian food. The decor, lighting, and atmosphere were very soothing and relaxing. Not overly loud so could easily hold a conversation with my friend (LOL). We had appetizers earlier so wish we had ordered one meal to share because we were going to a show and could not take any leftovers with us. The portions were very generous, the huge chunks of lamb were perfectly cooked, and the sauces were moderately spiced and very enjoyable. Honestly, we nearly had an entire meal left and were disappointed to leave so much great food. All of the staff were friendly and engaging. Would highly recommend and look forward to returning and eating ALL of our food on our next trip to Nashville.

We really enjoyed the food and ambiance at this restaurant. We love Indian food and weren't disappointed by this more modern take on traditional Indian food. The decor, lighting, and atmosphere were very soothing and relaxing. Not overly loud so could easily hold a conversation with my husband (LOL). We had appetizers earlier so wish we had ordered one meal to share because we were going to a show and could not take any leftovers with us. The portions were very generous, the huge chunks of lamb were perfectly cooked, and the sauces were moderately spiced and very enjoyable. Honestly, we nearly had an entire meal left and were disappointed to leave so much great food. All of the staff were friendly and engaging. Would highly recommend and look forward to returning and eating ALL of our food on our next trip to Nashville.

Absolutely delicious. Just perfect. It's not cheap food but it shouldn't be because there is a lot of care put into it. Ambiance is cozy and lovely. Service was flawless. Can't say a single bad thing.

I've been wanting to try this for months, so my birthday seemed like the perfect time. The staff was so friendly and the service was great. When my husband made the reservation he informed them of my onion allergy and they accommodated me and took it seriously (rare).I had the lamb chops, so juicy and flavorful. All 5 of us loved our food and cocktails. The cheesecake was also fantastic. We will definitely be back!

Great appetizers and wonderful ideas about Indian fusion cuisine.  The main courses were less than what we expected. Very mild, even sweet.  Their duck was sweet, the meat & three was made up of sweet vegetables and just edible chicken.

No need for dessert once you finish your meal.  
The staff was very nice and helpful.

name: Barcelona Wine Bar
address: 1200 Villa Pl Suite 110, Nashville, TN 37212, USA
reviews: The food here was amazing! All of the tapas we tried were great and well made. We ordered 4 to share and paella for 1 split between two and the chicken pimientos. While the paella was truly amazing and everyone was very happy with it, the chicken pimientos truly stole the show. The sauce was amazing and they offered bread to sop up the extra because everyone generally loves it so much. Will be returning for another fine dining night

I am in town for the weekend to attend classes at Vanderbilt, and had the pleasure of starting my trip with dinner at Barcelona with 2 colleagues. My last experience at Barcelona was in CT for my baby shower 12 years ago, and this latest adventure did not disappoint. We enjoyed each dish more than the next -- the empanadas, the Brussels, the spinach chickpea deliciousness, and the Spanish tortilla. And a piece of magical cake... I don't know what it was, but it was wonderful. The restaurant manager went out of his way to make us feel welcomed and attended to, especially when there was a mix-up on our food. Total home run, would go back again.

With a bit of a rustic feel, we enjoyed our time and meal here. The service was good considering the size of group (16). 

Note there is valet parking available but it was difficult to spot.  Their stand is on the sidewalk and there were cars parked in front of it. Either way, there was easy parking in the pay lot less than a block away.

Tonight we celebrated Valentine’s Day with our 8 month old Daughter tagging along! The whole staff was so sweet per usual and the food was incredible. Fourth visit, ordered different items each time and have yet to eat something we didn’t thoroughly enjoy! Special shout out to the General Manager Dan G. for making our night out with the little one extra special. He checked on us multiple times to make sure that we were being taken care of. His professionalism and hospitality is over and beyond. It makes perfect since why quality and service is top notch here with a GM like that!!

My fiance and my favorite restaurant in Nashville! We have not had one item that wasn't delicious from the menu; and the wine list is excellent. Do not hesitate to come here! The ambiance is great, but try to get a reservation for dinner cause it gets busy.

name: etc. restaurant
reviews: My family visit the restaurant for Sunday brunch. The food was great. The atmosphere was good as well. It was quiet and quiet intimate. Only complaint is the restaurant isn't family friendly. We had a 3 and 4 year old and they do not have any type of kids menu. We were able to put some things together for them but that wasnt ideal. They offer complementary valet and he was amazing.

I don't know how to go back to normal food after this. It's too delicious. 

Also, Bret is an amazing server. Super passionate about the food and wines he serves. Makes the experience that much better. :)

Last night was Date night. The etc. was marvelous. The staff, the food, and atmosphere was perfect. We met the chef and she is awesome. Thank you etc. for making such an perfect night. You can not go wrong with etc. You will have an glorious time and great food.

I think it's kind of funny that a restuarant like this is in Nashville. Deb and her team would easily get a Michelin star if they were in New York or something. 

Everything on the menu is fantastic and you'll have a great experience. If I have one complaint, it's the limited wine list, but honestly that doesn't matter. Recommend checking to see if Deb is in the kitchen during your visit -- you've got to meet her!

Hands down one of the best filet's I've had in quite some time!! Amazing presentation as well. The service was OK but it seemed like the server was just robotically doing his job. No personality or warmth. The valet service was excellent though!

name: Bastion
address: 434 Houston St STE 110, Nashville, TN 37203, USA
reviews:
This is a must try dining experience when you’re in Nashville (if you can score a reservation).

The restaurant itself is almost a secret entrance of sorts connected to its sister bar. It’s gorgeous inside and everyone (for the most part) sits at the chef’s counter.  You basically get 1 on 1 service from very skilled chefs. The ambience was so unique.

Overall service was some of the best we’ve had. It was so nice chatting to the chef about places he’s tried and to see how passionate he was about food—it was amazing. 

Drink menu was top notch. So many good cocktails, wine and beer that it’s tough to make a choice.

Food was incredible. Bold flavours and great portion sizes. Did not leave there feeling like I needed to be loaded with a forklift but I was plenty full.  The menu layout was so unique and we loved it. 

It was just such a great experience. Will 100% go back when we are in Nashville next time.

This is a fantastic dining experience in a `secret` room off from the side of the bar.  The staff was absolutely top notch, answering any question you might have, and providing a very welcoming environment. Instead of choosing, we just did the Bring It All and Fly Blind combination. At the end, don't miss the private bar inside as they have a top notch bartender and selection of whisky/drinks.

Went for our daughter’s birthday. Did the entire tasting menu plus wine pairing. Everything was exceptional. Portions are small but every bite is meant to be savored. Truly a delight for epicures. If you value quantity for the price, this is not the place for you. If you enjoy experiencing new and unusual, yet remarkable tastes, bastion is a great destination. Staff is friendly, helpful, attentive, and unpretentious. Atmosphere is unique. Take time to get a drink at the private bar before dinner.

I am just speechless. Every dish was perfectly balanced. They put together ingredients that I individually dislike and made them taste beautiful. What a wonderful meal. The drinks and the service were incredible as well.

Got a last minute reservation at 9:30pm and went straight here from the airport on day one of vacation. We sat at the bar and had a great dinner. Seems like they're just a bunch of really talented, dedicated young chefs who enjoy making really amazing dishes. Staff heard we were visiting and wrote out a bunch of other dining spots we should check out.

name: Folk
reviews: We loved the contemporary, casual setting. Also, it is wonderful to see a menu that doesn't have only the expected fine-dining fare. While a conservative diner can find traditional dishes, there's also interesting options for the adventuresome. We went family style and sampled an unusual pizza with great ingredients, a delicious salad and a chicken dish.

This was our second time at Folk, we had the same waitress and both the food and service were phenomenal. This is quickly becoming our favorite restaurant in Nashville. This is owned by the same folks who own Rolf and Daughters. It's family style food that will fill you up but not leave you feeling heavy. Do make a reservation!

This trip was my second visit here, and both times were incredible. I'm from out of town or I would be here regularly. The food (including dessert) is delicious! The clam pizza is a must if you like clams/seafood, or if you're feeling adventurous. Service was especially good this time around (I believe our server was Hannah.). I will be back the next time I'm in Nashville.
Such a great place with super staff. Everyone who works here has extensive knowledge of the menu and they serve very well. I always recommend!

Our new favorite restaurant! The pizza is to die for - best dough in the city. Cocktails were great. Everything else on the menu was fantastic but the pizza was definitely the best. Will come back many times to sit at the bar and get a pizza with a couple of drinks.

name: Merchants
reviews: We sat at the bar for lunch on a Saturday here. Our bartender was excellent and made a fantastic Bloody Mary. Our food was great, we just ordered sandwiches but they were very tasty. Even the free popcorn they hand out at the bar was delicious! We ended up spending more time here than we expected just because it was such a great atmosphere. We would definitely come back.

First off, I got a genuine smile from every person on staff when I walked in. And it just got better from there. My waiter Jimmy was friendly, fun, and gave me an excellent whiskey recommendation! The fried catfish sandwich was straight up excellent. Real, home style cornmeal fried catfish with a house made tarter sauce that puts it right over the top. This was the best place I went to on my entire trip to Nashville! Great job guys!

I had a WONDERFUL evening! I spent my 3 year anniversary here with my boyfriend and we both had a great night! We made reservations online, and when I called to verify my reservations we told them we were celebrating three years together. All of the staff made us feel very welcomed and special on our night. They all signed a card for us too! My waitress was very sweet and always made sure we had refills. She even told the chef to make my chicken, which was so delicious, into the shape of a heart! We will definitely be spending our 4th anniversary here!

Unbelievably wonderful staff at Merchants! A hand made Birthday card was presented to me after our meal in lieu of dessert. Went way out of their way for my gluten intolerance. Food was absolutely delicious too.
Excellent food and affordable for Broadway.  Party of five seated quickly upstairs on a Saturday night.  Good pours.  Spotty service though.  Manager was very helpful.  Our personal server was so so.

name: Hattie B's Hot Chicken - Midtown Nashville, TN
reviews: We went to the Melrose location, the was a small line, but we only waited maybe 20-30 minutes from when we got there until we were served our food. We both went with sandwich’s. My friend isn’t big on spicy so he went with mild which he said was very enjoyable, just a hint of spice that builds a little. I like spicy but was too chicken to get the hot, which is the fourth spicy option, there are two levels above hot. The Medium was a nice amount of heat without being uncomfortably hot. Looking back I should have gotten Hot. The chicken was moist all the way through. The collard greens were good and the red skin potato salad was average. Overall very good chicken!

Line was long but only had to wait about 40 minutes to get served. The chicken was absolutely amazing. I did the medium and it was just spicy enough for me. Macaroni and crinkle fries were great sides I had with it. I should of ordered small dark instead of large dark. Way to much food, got a to go box and will be able to enjoy some chicken tomorrow. If you get to Nashville it’s a must go to restaurant. The staff was awesome also, friendly and always had a smile on their face.

Tried it for the first time today and it was amazing. My husband and I both got the same thing. 3 chicken tenders which are good size and it comes with two sides. We got fries and the pimento mac n cheese. I'm not big on pimentos but you couldn't even taste that. It was all VERY good. I got medium spice and my husband got hot and it was perfect. Good spice level if you like spicy and good flavor at the same time. Will definitely be back. The guy working the register was super helpful and nice as well. Great customer service!!

A number of us went to the restaurant. People got the chicken sandwiches and chicken tenders with all 4 types of heat you can put on the tenders. Everyone enjoyed their sandwiches, a few stating they were better than others they had experienced in chain restaurants. We got the mac and cheese and fries as sides which were very good. I got the Gluten Free chicken tenders, no sauce due to food allergies, they were cooked just right, moist and tendrer.

A must visit! This is hands down the best run out of the group. The line was long but went fast and totally worth the wait. Super clean and friendly. The mild chicken tenders did not disappoint and the Mac and Cheese is the BEST! The greens are big, leafy, and tasty. Local craft beers are on tap and very cold. I don't care how much of a hurry we are in we always have time for this Hattie B restaurant.

name: Tailor Nashville
reviews: This is a great introduction to course meals that aren't the typical American or French we have so much of in the US. I enjoyed all the courses we tried but none stood out as anything world changing. If I was from the area I would consider coming back frequently, it's very good.

Our table of 4 was anticipating the experience and we were not disappointed. We loved the way the food was presented and explained by the wait staff. But even better, Chef Vivek Surti then tells a story of how this dish made it to the menu as related to a childhood memory or a family member. We really felt like we had been invited to his home to dine. Definitely a unique experience.

What an incredible evening! I think Heather manages the front of the house, and she was extremely accommodating due to a loss in the family on my girlfriend's side. I couldn't be more grateful to her and the restaurant for their help. When we visited this past weekend, myself and everyone in our party was blown away! The flavors, wine pairings, service, ambiance, etc, etc, etc was absolutely perfect! The atmosphere was very welcoming and unpretentious and we loved Chef Vivek's explanation of each dish. The price was more than reasonable and we finished without feeling overly stuffed or hungry. There is so much thought that goes into each course and each pairing and the execution shines when left with the experience. I will definitely be back.
Chef Vivek hosted a wonderful dinner, felt like I was at a friends place! Can't wait to go back! Beverage pairing was on point! Mom was correct can't be desert without chocolate!
Excellent & unique experience, great stories, and great service. Everything was so well balanced and a great blend of Vivek's family history to his current memories.

name: The Mockingbird
reviews: I love mockingbird! The vibe and decor is so nice. Not too loud, but great energy. Loved the waitress we had. Super cool and funky feel to everything. You gotta get the punch! Comes in a bag with a fun straw. The punch when I went was blackberry something(?) and it was to die for. I love the chicken and mashed potatoes, Mac and cheese, and French fries. Portions are pretty huge, so be

Love this place! The staff were very friendly, and the location and decor was unbeatable. Parking is a little hard during busier times, but it is available. We came for Taco Tuesday and loved all of it. The drinks were excellent, the food was delicious, and service was great. We will definitely be back!

Hands down my favorite restaurant in Nashville. Every single dish I’ve ordered is delectable. My favorite small plate is Don’t Worry, Brie Happy. The atmosphere reminds me of the Great Gatsby. I’d feel comfortable there for both a special occasion date or a casual after work drink. Brian and Mikey have done a fantastic job building a staff of friendly front of house and a menu with staples and rotating dishes. I highly, highly recommend this restaurant to everyone in Nashville!!

Food was good. Not all meals came out at once. I had to sit and watch everyone else eat for a little. We had a large group to manage. No complaints on the food. Their cinnamon roll dessert was delicious.

Went to celebrate Valentine's Day. Such a great dinner. The brussel sprouts as an appetizer were a great start. The pork schnitzel was AMAZING and I can't wait to go back to get it again! Seriously one of the best dishes I've ever eaten. The chocolate cake had this nice crispy crust to it that kind  of made it a cross between a cake and brownie. So good. We also moved mid meal  (at our suggestion) to accommodate a larger party next to us. The manager brought us glasses of champagne as a thank you which was a great way to toast to a fantastic date night.

name: Hathorne
reviews: Amazing happy hour menu and cocktails. Highly recommend the Audrey cocktail. The food was exceptional and reasonably priced. Also, plenty of sharable items. I will definitely be back to try more of the cocktails!

The service was very kind and attentive, “joyful hour” was amazing in the fact that it is Monday- Saturday 5-7 and had wonderful deals, and the atmosphere was really great for a date or a group. The veggies, starters, and sides we ordered were all wonderful but sadly both of our meat dishes were overcooked and the flavor wasn’t outstanding. I would come back for Happy Hour and for the sides but not for the entrees. Overall a good experience though, which is where the 4 stars comes from.

Incredible hospitality. Owner came over and offered some drinks for our anniversary (we also know him through someone else). But they were so kind and complimentary and made sure everything was great, and it was. Will definitely be back and excited to bring friends. Highly recommend the Brussels, cocktails, and chicken! Also had a delicious cheese and chocolate plate which was divine.

It was our first night ever in Nashville and what a  wonderful introduction!! The food was amazing, the staff were lovely and attentive and the owner was both charming and helpful. He went the extra mile giving us tips on enjoying the weekend and the history of the building/church. A top ten dining experience for me. Highly recommend!!

This was an EXCELLENT experience! The food just kept getting better and better with every dish they brought. I'm a vegetarian so we only ate off the left side of the menu, but it was very filling and so tasty. I don't think anything was bad at all. Titus was of server and he was very attentive and was on the spot everyone we needed anything. The atmosphere was great and there is a real missed vice inside and kinda of laid back. They also have an excellent drink menu is that is your thing.

name: Martin's Bar-B-Que Joint
reviews: First visit was great. We came in with a large group (at least 20) and were still able to get seated very quickly given the crowd they already had. The staff was awesome! very friendly. Our food came out quickly and everything was really good. My daughter had the chicken tenders I had the pork sandwich they were delicious. Atmosphere was great. Not one person from our group had a single complaint. The prices were reasonable, the portion sizes were perfect. Ordered a drink from the bar, it came out quick, well made and not overpriced. It’s short walk from the convention center. I would highly recommend to anyone in the area.

I haven't had proper BBQ in what feels like years. This was my first time visiting Nashville and I had to get myself some ribs. Absolutely top notch. Famous Dave's used to be my favorite BBQ place, but Martin's ribs are so much better. Their deviled eggs, baked beans, and wings are really great, too. I definitely left a very happy trucker!

This place is GREAT. We got the big mama's platter which had brisket, ribs, pulled pork, and a couple sides. We also got wings. It was enough to feed 4 hungry women. Our bartender gave us some suggestions on what to order and which sauces to get and she was spot-on. Everything was moist, flavorful, and delicious. We then went upstairs and listened to a band in their backyard garden space. It's a great spot for a casual hangout. Would return 100%.

Good food! Lots of seats so bring your friends 😉 line to order can get long so be ready to wait. They do a good job at keeping the line moving through. It can be loud. It is kid friendly.  They have a upstairs area as well with some games. They have a full bar so lots of drinks to choose from.  The staff is very nice and do there best to help you.

I was lucky enough to visit 3 weeks ago (yes, this was VERY necessary and overdue).
Food was SO good!!! Atmosphere and staff were so awesome. Bartender was knowledgeable of drinks and was very kind. Next time I visit Nashville I will DEFINITELY revisit Martin’s 💕

name: Pita Plus Gyro
reviews: I've eaten at Pita Plus Gyros a couple of times during my visits to Columbia and the food is really good. I've had the grilled chicken plate on both occasions and it was wonderful. The staff is outgoing and friendly and the food is wonderful! It's a hidden gym that you definitely need to try when you are in Columbia, TN. We go here regularly for lunch from work in downtown Columbia. Has to be the best Greek I have ever tried. The spinach pie is the best.
Great authentic-tasting gyros right in Nashville’s Arcade.

A comfortable, speedy, and mindful restaurant run by the most amicable Kurdish people. They offer crisp and hot Mediterranean-style nourishment for a stunning worth, and beat a large number of the other encompassing diners on nature of nourishment.

A cozy, quick, and attentive eatery run by the friendliest Kurdish folks. They offer fresh and hot Mediterranean-style food for an amazing value, and beat many of the other surrounding eateries on quality of food.

The woman who took my order would give Chick-Fil-A’s staff a run for their money. She was SO kind and spoke to everyone as if she’d known them forever. She’s just so friendly and chipper!

The gyro plate and pistachio baklava were both very delicious as well.

name: Lyra
address: 935 W Eastland Ave, Nashville, TN 37206, USA
reviews: Delicious food. Eclectic menu.  Friendly service in a welcoming environment.  Drinks overpriced but otherwise an enjoyable dining experience.

Went with my aunt who was in town. My wife and I had never been before. We were all so happy with our dinner experience. The food was great quality, the flavors were marvelous, and the cocktails were incredible. This is now our go to spot to take people who visit us. Incredible place.

Make Lyra regular dining experience, because if you're like me, you'll never leave disappointed. I've loved every experience I've had here, from when I was formerly on the business to business side selling to Liz and Hrant and as an East Nashville community member who loves elegant dishes with exciting flavor enjoyed in a thoughtfully designed, community restaurant/bar on a mission to showcase flavors from Eastern Europe and the Middle East using Southeast regionally-sourced ingredients! Not to mention the wine selection is consistently intriguing. I'm not sure if there is any other spot in Nashville offering Bulgarian, Turkish or Lebanese wines on the same menu with beautifully curated selections from France, Spain, Italy and United States? Their draft beer is local, and their cocktails offer a unique twist with balanced flavors that mirror the philosophy of the food menu. They're always playing great music, and the menu pricing offers amazing value considering the level of quality of food and beverage.
Good restaurant,  good service. We tried the kibee and the cauliflower.. kibee was good, missed a lime to add some flavour. Cauliflower was too sweet for my taste.

This is one of Nashville's best restaurants by far. I have been around 10 times and the service is always great, the food is always fantastic, full of flavor, and interesting. Their hummus and pita is a game changer, their cocktails are always wonderful, and their rack of lamb is unreal. I love Lyra so very much and I am so glad Nashville has this gem.

name: Butchertown Hall
reviews: Excellent service. Meal was delicious. Two thumbs up from this Texan on the brisket. Awesome cocktails. The decor is a delightful combination of farmhouse and industrial. Will definitely be back!

Blown away by the butchertown hall. Really good food overall, the appetizers were devoured by the table. The drinks were great too and the service was quick and friendly.

The lone slight disappointment was the brisket that happened to be a little dry that day. Not a huge deal but hope it isn’t that way every day

Best food we have had in Nashville, hands down. Amazing meat dishes with a really varied menu. We weren’t drinking so the handmade sodas were an extra bonus. Also commend the great service. Final thing was the beautiful restaurant space. Couldn’t recommend more.

All the way from Florida and hands down the best food I have ever had 10/10 and I have had good places but this one hits very different, the surroundings and everything was perfect. I would definitely drive 8 hours again just to eat here
Awesome service and unbelievable food. In town for two days. We had brunch here the first day and loved it so much that we went back again the second day.

name: The Farm House
reviews: Pimento cheese beignets were amazing. Short ribs were excellent, and the sides that came with were good (above average). The meatball with spaghetti squash was good and the Brussels sprouts with pork belly were great. Everything was fresh and beautifully presented. Portions were not huge, but we were plenty full with no room for dessert. Atmosphere was quiet and elegant but friendly and comfortable. Great, knowledgeable service; our server checked on us just enough.

I stopped by on a Wednesday evening while travelling for work and ordered the half chicken. Overall, it was pretty good. The pumpkin, carrots, potatoes served with the chicken were excellent. I found the chicken breast came out a little dry, but the rest was great. 

I enjoyed the casual atmosphere, and the staff was friendly and attentive. There was a large group and the service was still quick.

Overall, I'd recommend giving it a shot. I enjoyed it, and liked their menu, which focuses on locally sourced ingredients.

Great place to dine while in Nashville. I locally sourced restaurants and this place did really good. Homey atmosphere and great chearful staff. The chicken was well prepared and very moist. I loved the turnips and was wanting more. Very good portions. I think the $31 price was a little high for half a chicken but it was a hearty and filling dish. The deviled eggs were simple with a mustard base (I'm partial to mayo) but were still tasty. At $8 for 5 eggs though I was hoping for a little more flavor WOW. I would recommend this place as it's a great example of evolving seasonality type menus and supports local producers.

Was a fun night out with the husband. Food was good but not great although the cornbread was worth the wait. Brisket entree was filling but my favorite part was the broccolini (not the brisket). Service was nice and drink selection pretty awesome. Took a yummy dessert home - cheesecake - that was so good. Fun one time experience, likely wouldn't return.

Pimento cheese beignets were amazing. Short ribs were excellent, and the sides that came with were good (above average). The meatball with spaghetti squash was good and the Brussels sprouts with pork belly were great. Everything was fresh and beautifully presented. Portions were not huge, but we were plenty full with no room for dessert. Atmosphere was quiet and elegant but friendly and comfortable. Great, knowledgeable service; our server checked on us just enough. Meal with an appetizer and a couple of beverages was about $90 plus tip. We want to go back for the beignets and to try something else.

name: Geist Bar + Restaurant
reviews: Everything we ate was delicious. The atmosphere here is wonderful: candles everywhere, comfortable seating, refurbished wood... the only concern we had was that it was a little dark! Our waiter brought us extra candles which helped, but I wish there was just a smidge more light! It is a little on the pricey side, but the food was definitely artfully curated. Probably not a place I can go often, but a nice place for a special meal

Place is super cute. Had a reservation but didn’t get seated right away, had to wait 30 minutes.... but they made up for it and gave us a few complementary appetizers so I was okay with it. Food was GREAT, drinks were great!

What a wonderful discovery! An exceptional service and everything was good for a reasonable price. Their carpaccio is a trip to paradise, like, out of this world. The best ever! We, as in epicurean, food lover and world travellers, we recommand Geist. A very enjoyable moment of pleasure. Great place! Food options were limited but on point. Everything ordered was prepared and presented well and delicious. The night we visited was chilly but will come back to dine in outside patio.

My friends and I found this to be a completely delightful restaurant.  We sat at a table in the bar area where many regulars were watching a football game. Our server was friendly and knowledgeable.  The entire place was intimate and cozy.  We all enjoyed our dinner.  My filet was cooked perfectly.  There was a very nice wine selection.  If I lived in Nashville, I would be a regular.

The place is absolutely lovely. We went on a rainy day for brunch. We were sat in a cozy corner where we could watch the rain fall, the food was fantastic and our server was amazing. Highly recommend.

name: Pancho & Lefty's Cantina
reviews: Amazing little spot! We enjoyed DELICIOUS tacos! We both got the “any two tacos” - crispy pork and hot chicken on corn tortillas. Crispy pork ones were the best! The onion straws on top made the taco. The salsa is made with fire roasted tomatoes and was so so so good. I also had the cosmic cactus - wonderful! We loved being able to chill for a few during lunch and people watch. Definitely recommend!!
Oh my goodness was this by far the best tacos, nachos I have ever had. Delicious,fresh,creamy. You must not contemplate this choice just go!! And be sure to ask for Steven on the roof top!

Overall, we had a great experience.

Everyone enjoyed their food and the service was superb. We did come in right before close, so the food could have been a little bit better but the service more than made up for it. The margaritas were very good. They use their own in house juice for the margarita mix. I would definitely recommend this place.

This was my first time eating there and I have to say I was impressed. It is open sitting on the first and third floors (third floor is roof top). The tacos are regular sized soft shells but they stuff them very full. The ground beef is seasoned well. Nice atmosphere.
Great street tacos. Highly recommend the chicken. Service was friendly too.

name: Hattie B's Hot Chicken - West Nashville, TN
reviews: The food is amazing. We ordered takeout tonight and you guys killed it. We just parked and food came in less then a minute. They gave us all the sauces, utensils, and ketchup. The best takeout experience ever. Thank you for your attention to detail,  Kellen! 5 star service!

Always love eating here when I'm visiting. Of all the chicken places, this is the fastest and the most consistent in quality. The sandwich is delicious and massive. The heat levels have plenty to offer for everyone. Their mac and cheese is great and helps cool down your tongue while you're sweating. Still crossing my fingers they open a location in Knoxville!

AWESOME chicken and great sides!  I visited once 4 years ago and was an immediate believer!  I'm in town for 4 days and have already eaten there the first two.  Don't be scared off by a line out the door... they're efficient at getting people through.  It's totally worth a wait.  Only Negative... They haven't yet opened a DC location!!!  Come to Northern VA PLEASE!!!

Hot, fast chicken! Service is excellent. The staff is super friendly and attentive. Don't worry... The line that leads down the side of the building is very deceptive. It moves fast and customers rotate quickly out to make room for more. If you are weak like me, get the lowest heat possible. My husband liked the hottest level but I don't enjoy tears or sweat in my food even if it's my own. Oh, and get the mac n cheese!

So.good. I got the chicken breast, hot with black eyed pea salad and red skin potato salad. The salads were super fresh and the chicken was PERFECT! So juicy and the seasoning was amazing! The hot was the perfect level of heat and still very tasty! Would go back again and recommend to anyone!

name: Sunda Nashville
reviews: This is my new favorite restaurant. Our server was attentive and friendly, the food was delicious to say the least, and the atmosphere is beautiful. This is a great spot for a date or a long night out to really have a dining experience. And when I say the food was delicious, all of it was! The appetizers, main course, and dessert! Perfect evening, I will definitely return. Oh, also they have quality old fashions here (no cherry, they use one good ice ball, not tons of ice cubes like amateurs).

My first visit to Sunda was great. We sat at the bar and were seen to immediately for brunch. The interior is lovely and very clean. I was impressed with the menu - not too much but still a lot of variety. Overall very pleased with the service and the food. I will definitely be coming back for dinner service.
Unfortunately while the waitress was very nice she clearly was stretched too thin. Very simple small dinner took well over 2 hours. Food was fine but not impressive. Nice atmosphere.

Very popular place with nice seating, large eat-at bar, and great atmosphere. Good service and delicious food. I had spicy shrimp sushi which was packed with tasty ingredients. Also had an Old Fashioned which was very good! Reservations recommended since it was really crowded.

I am not a big fan of paying a whole lot for food. Four of us went to ready there and my meal with scrambled egg whites was bland. It was also the least appealing of the meals served. There was a good portion of it which was nice, however, that doesn't really make up for overpriced bland food that could easily have been seasoned better.

name: 5th & Taylor
reviews: The beef cheek stew and beer can kitchen was amazing! The ambience was incredible and the service was great. I also enjoyed the cocktails as an old fashioned is one of my favorites and it was impressive. A small drink for my liking but the flavor and alcohol content was spot on. I’ll definitely be back to take the wife on another date. Great scene. Make a reservation though.

Wonderful place for some new American cuisine. The beet salad, scallops with gooseberries and popcorn reduction, grouper and cookie pie were amazing start to finish. The drink selection was stellar as well. Nice ambiance in the dining area although I sat at the bar.

From cocktails to desert, spectacular! Steaks cooked to perfection. Drink was incredible try the gin drinks, steak tartar, mushrooms wow! One of the best dinners I have ever had. Thank you for a wonderful dinner! Nick & Carmen ❤

The atmosphere, the upscale tastes at reasonable prices...it's the perfect date night or special occasion getaway. If I could eat the Beef Cheek Pot Roast every day of my life, I would die a happy man. Simply perfection. The specialty drinks, the huge selection of favorites, multiple pleasures for every palate...they really can do no wrong. As a side note, if you want to make someone extremely happy, send them a gift card from 5th & Taylor. It will make you a hit! I promise.

Wow. Awesome atmosphere, excellent service, tasty vittles. Each dish had it's own character, with surprising bursts of flavor scattered throughout. The duck wings were really special with a slightly sweet tang. Even the mashed potatoes were marvelous, with a creamy butteriness that was ever so smooth. Highly recommended.

name: The Treehouse
reviews: Outstanding food and service. Interesting, unique flavors. It was a slow Tuesday night but it seemed like every staff member came to our table and checked on us at some point. The coffee rubbed carrot appetizer was great. The potato fritters were unlike anything I’ve ever had. And the pork with parsley was so moist and fresh. We were blown away. I loved watching the chef remove a slice of chess pie out of the oven, rather than a microwave. It’s details like that that make all the difference.
Everything was fantastic. Service was perfectly timed. Food full of wonderfully blended flavors. Awesome culinary experience. Deeply rooted and out on a limb by itself. Highly recommend!

The food was great.  The service was good.  
Our server Chris was distracted and not very attentive, but the greeter Michael was awesome.  He engaged with us and ensured everything was taken care of in Chris' absence.  He deserves high praise.  

We were there for East Nashville Restaurant week and the servings were teeny tiny.  I know serving sizes are usually smaller for restaurant week...but this was crazy.  Rabbit stew was literally only 4 tablespoons of stew.  For $18...that's approx $4.50 per spoonful!

Really enjoyed our meal here. We popped in for a late dinner (around 10 pm) and were pleasantly surprised! So many late night spots have great drinks and mediocre food, but Treehouse has great food and drink. The food was interesting, delicious and light enough that we could sample several dishes, and the drinks were tasty and novel. Staff was friendly, and the restaurant is cute. Definitely worth checking out, even if it's not late.

We really like this place because of the atmosphere and especially the drinks. The menu rotates so it isn’t always the same. We had the asparagus, potatoes, & cheese plate. Nothing disappointed! We couldn’t finish it all. The cocktails were really good, didn’t have anything we didn’t like. I highly recommend the cheese plate— the honeycomb goes really well with all the options. We will absolutely will be going back!

name: Redheaded Stranger
reviews: Fresh tortillas paired with both classic and adventurous fillings makes this one of my favorite places to get breakfast tacos in Nashville. They have a bar and serve coffee for whatever you are in the mood for. The have an array of fairly hot hot sauces to pair with your tacos. I do wish their home made Hot sauces were more salsa like. I will definitely be coming back.

This will be my new favorite restaurant for a very long time. The brisket taco with egg and cheese was outstanding. Fresh, homemade tortillas and salsa compliment this amazing food. I’m coming back for the green chili burger and more brisket!

Loved this place!! My brother and I came in from out of town to watch a Houston vs Tennessee football game and this place felt like home ❤️ The tacos were exceptional and reasonably priced. The service was wonderful and very friendly. I also really appreciate that they were willing to accommodate certain dietary restrictions without questioning. Our only complaint was the coffee tasted a little weak, but we're very particular about our coffee ☕

Some of the best tacos in Nashville. The tortillas are out of this world, the house hot sauces are so creative and delicious, and the overall ambiance of the restaurant is great. This is a staple in my family for sure. Please go check them out!

I found out about Redheaded Stranger via Instagram recently and decided to check it out on a day off from work. I ordered 3 tacos and they were much bigger than expected. I left stuffed! All were delicious. I also had a good Mimosa. The atmosphere is nice. It's super cute. All staff was very friendly. I'll definitely be back!

name: The Southern Steak & Oyster
address: 150 3rd Ave S Ste 110, Nashville, TN 37201, USA
reviews: This place never disappoints! My mom and I ate here and we had so much fun! Our waitress, Amanda, treated us wonderfully! She recommended yummy oysters, fabulous wine and even helped me to decide between 2 entrees. A great waitress, great good and great wine! We have eaten here many times but this was by far the most fun I have ever had and will always be my most remembered! Oh yeah, pick up some of the yummy ketchup they have for sale, while you are there!

Wow. I was extremely impressed by this place. Outstanding food, the oysters are among the freshest in town with a variety available. There is a happy hour special where you can get a dozen for $20 between 3pm-6pm. The smoked eggs were delicious and arrived in moments.

The Southern burger was seriously one of the best in town. Great bacon, juicy burger, tasty crispy straws, and the pimento cheese really set it over the top. 

The service was totally on point. Sat at the bar and they all were friendly, warm, and efficient. Overall layout was easy to navigate, and it had a nice laid back touch among the hustle and bustle of downtown Nashville. A++

The Southern Steak and Oyster restaurant/bar is conveniently located in the heart of music city Nashville! This very popular eatery serves traditional southern dishes, as well as a wide variety of other breakfast, brunch and dinner dishes, and a huge oyster menu! Gluten options are offered as well! The prices on food and drinks are moderate, and the service friendly and prompt! Private meeting rooms are available upon advanced reservations! This landmark restaurant is a must to visit!

Exceptional!!!  Great atmosphere and very attentive service by the staff.  The Oysters and Gumbo were both excellent starters and my Wind from the South salmon was fabulous.  Those in our party of 8 that had steak raved about how good it was.  We were all so full that none of us ordered dessert so cannot testify about that part of the menu but have to believe they are delicious if they are anything like the rest of our meal.  The bar selections are awesome so you can get pretty much anything you want from the full wall of bottles.  Great atmosphere, great service, & great food....just can't say enough good things about The Southern but can highly recommend it!!

My wife and I came here for dinner on our vacation. We ordered the hot chicken salad, dry aged steak, and a dozen oysters. The kitchen lost our ticket, which the waiter admitted to, and said we'd be "compensated" for our wait and apologized that he hadn't brought out the biscuits yet. The biscuits never came, he must have forgotten about them. The manager came by and hand delivered our oysters and brought out a complementary side salad we didn't ask for. 

Everything was good up to this point, although, my wife didn't want a side salad since she ordered a salad for dinner. The hot chicken salad she had was incredibly spicy, too spicy for the average person. The dry aged steak was fatty and undercooked. At the end of the night, we got the bill and when we looked to see what our "compensation" was, nothing was taken off the bill. The side salad we didn't ask for was our "compensation." There was no explanation from the waiter, no final apology for our long wait for the food, no acknowledgement that we were inconvenienced. 

It gets a star for good drinks and atmosphere, but we were unhappy with our food and service experience.

name: Kayne Prime Steakhouse
reviews: Took my sister to Nashville for her birthday and the loved the city. Upon a recommendation from the Hotel Hutton we had her birthday dinner at Kayne Prime. We were sat promptly and not only was the staff great, but the service was EXCELLENT! A must try is the Popcorn and movie butter lobster bites. The steak was spot on and the birthday dessert that was complimentary to my sister was in her words AMAZING.

Get the A5 Wagyu! Totally worth every penny. Getting that out there first. The progression of NY strip is also the way to go. Favorite side was the potato gratin, hands down. Service was exceptional from the host to the bartenders to our server (very knowledgeable and had the perfect recommendations). Every one of the staff made it a better experience than we expected. Easily our favorite dinner during our vacation in Nashville.

The food is absolutely incredible. The service is top notch and the drinks are hand crafted. Very nice atmosphere even around the bar area. Finally got to try the Japanese A5 waygu and it was worth every penny!

Took my friend to Nashville for her birthday and the loved the city. Upon a recommendation from the Hotel Hutton we had her birthday dinner at Kayne Prime. We were sat promptly and not only was the staff great, but the service was EXCELLENT! A must try is the Popcorn and movie butter lobster bites. The steak was spot on and the birthday dessert that was complimentary to my wife was in her words AMAZING.

Service was phenomenal. Had a drink at the bar which has a fantastic view before we were seated. The steak was perfectly cooked to medium rare with a nice outside char. The wagyu filet was melt in your mouth delicious with an affordable price at around $60. There is a dress code so while you are enjoying dinner you don't have to see people walking by in shorts or hats. The service, food, and atmosphere makes the price of dining well worth it.

name: Monell's At the Manor
reviews: Food was amazing. Family style/home cook meal food. For first timers like myself, you pretty much sit down and they bring in tons of various southern dishes. Dinner is $22. I highly recommend yo go with family or friends.

Great experience taking in true southern hospitality. The staff were all very friendly here and the food was excellent. We visited for brunch and the food was plentiful. We had a variety of southern comfort foods including fried chicken, corn pudding, cheesy grits, biscuits, cinnamon rolls, scrambled eggs, pancakes and many other delicious treats. Felt more like a local spot which we enjoyed. Food was great and is served family style. I usually do not enjoy this style but it was excellent and a great experience! Check it out while in Nashville.

Sit down and make a friend. The hostess specifically tells you to turn your phone to silent. In a world where we are so concerned with our phones and not talking with people this place is a welcome breakfast spot. We were forced to have a conversation with some strangers that turned out to be very pleasant. The food was real home cooked goodness. We’ll be back here for sure.

We were in TN visiting my daughter and son in law, they wanted to go somewhere special for my birthday. They made reservations at another restaurant, but I remembered going to Monell's years ago and so we changed out plans. Wasn't disappointed. The food was excellent and it just kept coming. So glad we chose this place. (A big of a ride from Clarksville, but well worth it.)
Great southern food and lots of it. We visited with friends and chatted and ate for hours. The staff was very nice. The interior is beautiful.

name: Pastaria
reviews: This place is delicious!! Get everything on the menu because I have never had a bad meal here!! Great staff and quality food
Excellent! Our waitress Kara was sweet and great. We sat at the bar by the pizza oven and made friends with Dustin. His fennel salami pizza is AWESOME. Almost worth moving for.

The food is always very good and the place itself has a nice feel. But too often the service is not very inviting or professional. Servers seem too concerned with looking cool and casual than being nice, at least that's how it seemed to me. I felt very lonely, rather than welcomed, and I dine alone all the time where this isn't the feeling I get. They know their regulars, though. I did notice that.
One of my favorite happy hours in town for my favorite wood brick oven pizzas and drinks. I love eating here and the pastas are delicious. Amazing Brussels sprouts too.

Wow. Just wow. This place is INCREDIBLE. They had a calzone that was a temporary menu item and it was heavenly. The service was excellent (Nate was one of the best servers I've had in Nashville). I can't recommend it highly enough.

name: Black Rabbit
reviews:
This was our first visit to Black Rabbit & we both LOVED it. This place has a great vibe, great live music, & incredibly skilled bartenders/mixologists. We typically stick with our regular drinks, but we branched out & tried 4 different drinks while there, 2 of which were on their cocktail menu, & two of which we asked for them to invent right there in front of us after they asked what we liked & didn't enjoy tasting. It was so very impressive! I am quite choosy about my spirits & the folks their simply know what they're doing & they were absolutely killing it with their skills & their imagination. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we're already planning on going back in a few weeks. 
 Unfortunately,  we did not eat there, since we had just visited there right after having dinner. We definitely will eat there next time b/c the rabbit rolls that my bar neighbor had looked & smelled outstanding. He kindly offered to give me a bite, but I was already stuffed from dinner. Next time,  I am going in hungry.

Black Rabbit is always an awesome choice you will not be disappointed. Great place to meet coworkers after work and get buzzed on a Tuesday or a wonderful choice for dinner before a Printer's Alley burlesque show on a Saturday night like we did. The ambiance is great. The food and service are comforting and professional. Thank you for always providing a great experience

Black Rabbit is always an awesome choice you will not be disappointed. Great place to meet coworkers after work and get buzzed on a Tuesday or a wonderful choice for dinner before a Printer's Alley burlesque show on a Saturday night like we did. The ambiance is great. The food and service are comforting and professional. Thank you for always providing a great experience

Wonderfully cozy and intimate atmosphere off the beaten path of downtown. I loved the fireplace and the variety of seating options. There's seating available right by the stage - up close and personal. The live band on Saturday night was delightful. I didn't find the music too loud in this establishment as some reviewers mentioned. It's hard to converse while any band is playing live anywhere so it is to be expected. I will return again.

Just to preface this, I went here as part of a corporate event so it's possible we didn't get the full experience. 

That said, the decorations were interesting (frosted stripper mirror and top hat hanging lights) and the space was cozy. Comfortable couches, fireplace, lots of tables and standing areas near the bar.

Food wise, I just wasn't impressed. The only thing I had that was above average was a slice of sour dough bread buttered with some flake salt. It was quite good. 

The corn tostada had some hummus that had some zing not not really any taste I would go back for. The tortilla wraps had a pulled pork and shredded beef that was relatively bland even with hot sauce. Dessert was a slice of citrus pound cake. It had a decent glaze but still nothing to write home about. 

If you're in the area and want a darker, upscale but cozy vibe with some friends, this might be a good spot for you. If you're just looking for good food, there is so much in the area, this probably won't be at the top of your list.

name: Acme Feed & Seed
reviews: Acme was recommended to us by a local who said it was one of the better places along Broadway. We stopped in just for drinks, but decided to have lunch after being tempted by the sushi on the second floor. They have a nice craft beer selection. Sushi was tasty and fresh, but the wings we also ordered came out lukewarm. Service was great and quick. The lower level and rooftop area were both slammed with people. We were grateful that the second level was not nearly so busy. Would be a great place to come out for a party.

Acme was recommended to us by a local who said it was one of the better places along Broadway. We stopped in just for drinks, but decided to have lunch after being tempted by the sushi on the second floor. They have a nice craft beer selection. Sushi was tasty and fresh, but the wings we also ordered came out lukewarm. Service was great and quick. The lower level and rooftop area were both slammed with people. We were grateful that the second level was not nearly so busy. Would be a great place to come out for a party.

Nice simple consent. Order your food at the front entrance area, food runner runs food out to you. I wasn’t expecting much but the food was pretty good. Live music was a nice touch! So close to the Pedestrian bridge which offers a nice walk and view after your quick bite.

Acme Feed & Seed is a great restaurant! I really enjoyed the live music; instead of just a typical loud country cover band, they had a really cool string band performing. Very good atmosphere, not too many drunk people in there (which is rare for Broadway!) and the food was simple but still great.

Fantastic place, food was really good and service was great. they went above and beyond to take care of us even though they were super busy. Band was really good and we enjoyed their set. Second floor was a chilled jazz lounge and then we went on the roof for a great view of the river and the lights wonderful place.

name: The Melting Pot
address: 166 2nd Ave N ste a, Nashville, TN 37201, USA
reviews:
Great for celebrations!

Melting pot totally exceeded my expectations. We visited the Nashville location for a friend’s birthday, and I was blown away! The fondue broth for the meats & veggies was tasty and there was well enough food for everyone. The desert fondue flambé blew my mind & was so rich as well!! Service was fast & funny, I really appreciated the waiter’s suggestions about the area when he found out we were visiting from out of town. 

It was a super smooth & memorable dinner, I’ll definitely be back!

The food, the atmosphere were excellent. Made even more so by server Michelle. She took the time to explain the various choices, made great recommendations and was totally attentive to our every need. We cannot say enough how happy we are with our choice to dine at The Melting Pot. This is a place for a special dinner when you're not in a hurry. It is a wonderful experience! Lacy took care of us so well and was able to answer all our questions and make helpful recommendations.

Our server was very friendly and helpful with the menu. We tried the grilled option for the first time for the main course and we loved it. We will order it again the next time we go! I ordered my favorite dessert fondue, the bananas foster, have had it before. The food, the atmosphere were excellent.  We definitely left full and satisfied.

The food, the atmosphere were excellent. Made even more so by server Michelle. She took the time to explain the various choices, made great recommendations and was totally attentive to our every need. We cannot say enough how happy we are with our choice to dine at The Melting Pot. This is a place for a special dinner when you're not in a hurry. It is a wonderful experience! Lacy took care of us so well and was able to answer all our questions and make helpful recommendations.

This was a wonderful experience. The waiter was professional, talkitive, enjoyed helping us learn the ways of the dinner. The food was AMAZING. Cheese fondue was awesome, salad was very good, and dinner was great. We especially liked the different sauces they give you to dip your meats in. Dessert was delicious as well, with lots of choices of things to dip in the chocolate you choose.

name: Trattoria Il Mulino
reviews:
If I could give Byron & team 10 stars, I would!

My husband & I were in Nashville for our 4 year wedding anniversary. Side note: we did eat at a different location that, at the time of the reservation, we did share that it was our anniversary trip. This establishment did not acknowledge it at all. However, we chose Trattoria Il Mulino for our actual anniversary dinner and BOY did they deliver!

The space itself is beautiful, a bit darker, and more intimate but the service for the whole night was, in a word, exceptional. We knew we chose right when we were seated & found a hand-written card wishing us a Happy Anniversary & signed by the entire staff! Our server Byron was so charming, attentive, and humorous as were the other staff members who took care of us. The food was also fantastic (try the ricotta meatballs!) and as if the date could not get any better, Byron told my husband of a shortcut from the restaurant (through the glass doors by the bathroom) through the Hilton right next door, to the street, to the pedestrian bridge for a romantic walk and dance on the bridge by night. 

My husband & I managed to have a *perfect date* and Trattoria Il Mulino, with it's wonderful service, food, & ambiance helped make it so. Thank you Byron & everyone working 7/24/2019--we look forward to seeing you again!

The food was amazing!!!! The service was great and I really enjoyed the complimentary appetizer spread with fresh bread. You really feel welcome and are able to enjoy the evening. It's near all the action but yet just far enough away that you heat the for traffic. Must add the bathrooms are extremely clean (

Wonderful meals!! Amazing allergy friendly options and the service was THE BEST and everyone was very polite! I ordered gluten free pasta (as shown below) and would highly recommend this dish to anyone, even without allergies. They also had plenty of options for another family member who is dairy and nut free. Overall one of the best restaurants I have ever been to!

Outstanding restaurant.  The ambience is nice like others.  It is the service and the food that sets this restaurant above others.  The managers and servers work together making this restaurant exceptional.  Pasta is made on in the restaurant.  I highly recommend the lobster over pasta.  Wine selection is impressive with floor to ceiling wine rack as pictured.  Prices are appropriate to the quality of the food.  Try it.  We celebrated our anniversary and they gave us a nice card.
Went on for a company dinner. Great options for vegetarians.  Descent cocktails, and good wine. The atmosphere is nice as well. Not sure if the prices, so make sure to check in advance.
